web_triggers:
#NOT_IN_NADEL_BLOCK_START Directives and Common types already defined in GQL GW

##################### BOILERPLATE HEADER #####################

"""Indicates a type that comes from another service on the GraphQL Gateway."""
directive @shared(from:String, to:String) on OBJECT | ENUM | INTERFACE | SCALAR | INPUT_OBJECT

"""
Relay-style Node interface.
"""
interface Node @shared(from:"common") {
    id: ID!
}

scalar URL @shared(from:"common")

# A mutation response. All mutations should return a type which implements this interface.
# See [Atlassian GraphQL Standards](https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GRAPHQL/pages/413770807/Mutation)
# and [Apollo GraphQL Documentation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/apollo-server/essentials/schema#mutation-responses)
interface MutationResponse {
    # A numerical code (such as a HTTP status code) representing the status of the mutation
    statusCode: Int!

    # Was this mutation successful
    success: Boolean!

    # A message for this mutation
    message: String!
}
#NOT_IN_NADEL_BLOCK_END
type Query {
    """
    Gets all webtrigger URLs for an application in a specified context.
    """
    webTriggerUrlsByAppContext(appId: ID!, envId: ID!, contextId: ID!): [WebTriggerUrl!]
}

type WebTriggerUrl implements Node {
    id: ID!
    appId: ID!
    envId: ID!
    triggerKey: String!
    extensionId: ID!
    contextId: ID!
    url: URL!
    """
    Cloud id extracted from the context id. Only populated if context id is a valid cloud context.
    """
    cloudId: ID
    """
    Product extracted from the context id (e.g. jira, confulence). Only populated if context id is a valid cloud context.
    """
    product: String

    #NADEL """
    #NADEL The tenant context for the cloud id. Only populated if context id is a valid cloud context.
    #NADEL """
    #NADEL tenantContext: TenantContext => hydrated from tcs.tenantContexts(cloudIds: $source.cloudId) object identified by cloudId, batch size 90
}

type Mutation {
    """
    Creates a webtrigger URL. If webtrigger url is already created for given `input` the old url will be returned
    unless `forceCreate` flag is set to true - in that case new url will be always created.
    """
    createWebTriggerUrl(input: WebTriggerUrlInput!, forceCreate: Boolean = false): CreateWebTriggerUrlResponse
    """
    Deletes a webtrigger URL.
    """
    deleteWebTriggerUrl(id: ID!): DeleteWebTriggerUrlResponse

}

input WebTriggerUrlInput {
    """
    Id of the application
    """
    appId: ID!

    """
    Environment id of the application
    """
    envId: ID!

    """
    Web trigger module key
    """
    triggerKey: String!
    """
    context in which function should run, usually a site context.
    E.g.: ari:cloud:jira::site/{siteId}
    """
    contextId: ID!
}

"""
Response from creating an webtrigger url
"""
type CreateWebTriggerUrlResponse implements MutationResponse {
    statusCode: Int!
    success: Boolean!
    message: String!
    """
    Url of the webtrigger. Populated only if success is true.
    """
    url: URL
    """
    Id of the webtrigger. Populated only if success is true.
    """
    id: ID
}

"""
Response from creating an webtrigger url
"""
type DeleteWebTriggerUrlResponse implements MutationResponse {
    statusCode: Int!
    success: Boolean!
    message: String!
}
xen_logs_api:
#NOT_IN_NADEL_BLOCK_START Directives and Common types already defined in GQL GW

##################### BOILERPLATE HEADER #####################

"""
Essential field for first version.
"""
directive @critical on FIELD_DEFINITION | INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION | ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
"""
Highly useful field for first or later versions.
"""
directive @important on FIELD_DEFINITION | INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION | ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
"""
Probably useful field for later versions.
"""
directive @nicetohave on FIELD_DEFINITION | INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION | ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
"""
Indicates a type that comes from another service on the GraphQL Gateway.
"""
directive @shared(
  from: String
  to: String
) on OBJECT | ENUM | INTERFACE | SCALAR | INPUT_OBJECT

"""
Relay-style Node interface.
"""
interface Node @shared(from: "common") {
  id: ID!
}

"""
A string that can be interpreted as a JSON blob with an arbitrary schema.
"""
scalar JSON @shared(from: "common")

"""
Relay-style PageInfo type.
"""
type PageInfo @shared(from: "common") {
  hasNextPage: Boolean!
  hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
  startCursor: String
  endCursor: String
}

#NOT_IN_NADEL_BLOCK_END
##################### QUERY #####################

type Query {
  # TODO: remove appLogs() from nadel;  This query becomes part of the AppEnvironment() query elsewhere once multi arg hydration is supported
  """
  `appLogs()` returns an object for paging over AppLog objects, each of which
  represents one invocation of a function.

  The returned objects use the Relay naming/nesting style of
  `AppLogConnection` → `[AppLogEdge]` →  `AppLog`.

  Internally, if you use no first, last, it will default last to 20.

  It takes parameters (`query: LogQueryInput`) to narrow down the invocations
  being searched, requiring at least an app and environment.
  """
  appLogs(
    """
    Defaults to 20 internally, if no other limit params are set
    """
    last: Int=20 @critical
    first: Int @important
    before: String @critical
    after: String @important
    """
    The app ID. Required.

    <!-- base64 encoded App ARI --> #NOT_IN_NADEL
    """
    appId: ID!
    """
    Specify which environment(s) to search.
    Must not be empty if you want any results.
    """
    environmentId: [ID!]!
    query: LogQueryInput @critical
  ): AppLogConnection @critical
  # TODO: NOT_IN_NADEL_BLOCK_END   #NOT_IN_NADEL

  """
  `appLogLines()` returns an object for paging over the contents of a single
  invocation's log lines, given by the `invocation` parameter (an ID
  returned from a `appLogs()` query).

  Each `AppLogLine` consists of a `timestamp`, an optional `message`,
  an optional `level`, and an `other` field that contains any
  additional JSON fields included in the log line.  (Since
  the app itself can control the schema of this JSON, we can't
  use native GraphQL capabilities to describe the fields here.)

  The returned objects use the Relay naming/nesting style of
  `AppLogLineConnection` → `[AppLogLineEdge]` →  `AppLogLine`.
  """
  appLogLines(
    first: Int = 100 @critical
    after: String @critical
    """
    The `id` returned from an appLog() query.
    """
    invocation: ID! @critical
  ): AppLogLineConnection @critical

  """
  Relay-style lookup-individual-node-by-global-ID.
  """
  node(id: ID!): Node @nicetohave

  """
  Check if developer has access to logs
  """
  developerLogAccess(
    """
    An array of context ARIs
    """
    contextIds: [ID!]!
    """
    AppId as ARI
    """
    appId: ID!
    """
    App environment
    """
    environmentType: AppEnvironmentType!
  ): [DeveloperLogAccessResult]

  """
  Return a list of installation contexts with forge logs access
  """
  installationContextsWithLogAccess(appId: ID!): [InstallationContextWithLogAccess!]
}

type Mutation {
  """
  Allows site admins to grant Forge log access to the app developer
  """
  updateDeveloperLogAccess(input: UpdateDeveloperLogAccessInput!): UpdateDeveloperLogAccessPayload
}

input UpdateDeveloperLogAccessInput {
  """
  An array of context ARIs
  """
  contextIds: [ID!]!

  """
  AppId as ARI
  """
  appId: ID!

  """
  App environment
  """
  environmentType: AppEnvironmentType!

  """
  Boolean representing whether access should be granted or not
  """
  shouldHaveAccess: Boolean!
}

enum AppEnvironmentType {
  DEVELOPMENT
  STAGING
  PRODUCTION
}

type UpdateDeveloperLogAccessPayload implements Payload {
  success: Boolean!
  errors: [MutationError!]
}

interface Payload {
  success: Boolean!
  errors: [MutationError!]
}

type MutationError {
  message: String
  extensions: MutationErrorExtension
}

type GenericMutationErrorExtension implements MutationErrorExtension {
  statusCode: Int
  errorType: String
}

interface MutationErrorExtension {
  """A numerical code (such as a HTTP status code) representing the error category"""
  statusCode: Int

  """Application specific error type"""
  errorType: String
}

##################### INPUT LogQueryInput & related #####################

"""
The input for choosing invocations of interest.
"""
input LogQueryInput {
  """
  Specify which installations you want to search.
  Optional: if empty will search all installations user has access to.

  #NOT_IN_NADEL <!-- TODO: CPFS-6712 figure out how this is represented.  -->
  """
  installationContexts: [ID!] @important

  """
  Limits the search to a particular function in the app.
  Optional: if empty will search all functions.
  """
  functionKey: String @nicetohave
  """
  Limits the search to a particular version of the app.
  Optional: if empty will search all versions of the app
  """
  appVersion: String @nicetohave

  """
  Limits the search to a particular date range.

  Note: Logs may have a TTL on them so older logs may not be available
  despite search parameters.
  """
  dates: DateSearchInput @important
}

"""
Which type of trigger
"""
enum FunctionTriggerType {
  FRONTEND
  MANUAL
  PRODUCT
  WEB
}

"""
Time ranges of invocation date.
"""
input DateSearchInput {
  """
  The start time of the earliest invocation to include in the results.
  If null, search results will only be limited by retention limits.

  RFC-3339 formatted timestamp.
  """
  earliestStart: String @important

  """
  The start time of the latest invocation to include in the results.
  If null, will include most recent invocations.

  RFC-3339 formatted timestamp.
  """
  latestStart: String @important
}

##################### INPUT LogGrepInput & related #####################

##################### RESULTS: AppLog #####################

"""
Relay-style Connection to `AppLog` objects.
"""
type AppLogConnection {
  edges: [AppLogEdge] @critical
  nodes: [AppLog] @nicetohave
  pageInfo: PageInfo! @critical
}

"""
Relay-style Edge to an `AppLog` object.
"""
type AppLogEdge {
  node: AppLog! @critical
  cursor: String! @critical
}

type AppLog implements FunctionInvocationMetadata & Node {
  #NOT_IN_NADEL # Invocation ID in base64 ARI format
  id: ID! @critical
  appId: ID! @important #NOT_IN_NADEL
  environmentId: ID! @important #NOT_IN_NADEL
  #NADEL appEnvironment: AppEnvironment          # TODO: not implemented in graphql gateway yet => hydrated from XXX.YYY(appId: $source.app, key: $source.environment)
  appVersion: String! @important
  installationContext: AppInstallationContext @important
  function: FunctionDescription @important
  trigger: FunctionTrigger @nicetohave
  moduleType: String @nicetohave
  """
  The start time of the invocation

  RFC-3339 formatted timestamp.
  """
  startTime: String @critical
  expirationTime: String @important #NOT_IN_NADEL
  """
  Gets up to 200 earliest log lines for this invocation.
  For getting more log lines use appLogLines field in Query type.
  """
  appLogLines(first: Int = 100): AppLogLines @critical
}

"""
The data describing a function invocation.
"""
interface FunctionInvocationMetadata {
  """
  The invocation ID
  Base64 Invocation ID ARI Format #NOT_IN_NADEL
  """
  id: ID! @critical
  """
                                                         #NOT_IN_NADEL
  The immutable id of the application                       #NOT_IN_NADEL
  """ #NOT_IN_NADEL
  appId: ID! @important #NOT_IN_NADEL
  """
                                                         #NOT_IN_NADEL
  The immutable id of the environment                       #NOT_IN_NADEL
  """ #NOT_IN_NADEL
  environmentId: ID! @important #NOT_IN_NADEL
  #NADEL """
  #NADEL The app and its environment
  #NADEL """
  #NADEL appEnvironment: AppEnvironment

  appVersion: String! @important
  """
  The context in which the app is installed
  """
  installationContext: AppInstallationContext @important
  """
  Metadata about the function of the app that was called
  """
  function: FunctionDescription @important
  """
  Metadata about what caused the function to run
  """
  trigger: FunctionTrigger @nicetohave
  """
  Metadata about module type
  """
  moduleType: String
}

type AppInstallationContext {
  id: ID!
}

type FunctionDescription {
  key: String! @critical
}

type FunctionTrigger {
  type: FunctionTriggerType @important
  key: String @critical
  # TODO: anything else should go here? e.g. which web trigger?  #NOT_IN_NADEL
}

##################### RESULTS: AppLogLine #####################

"""
Relay-style Connection to `AppLogLine` objects.
"""
type AppLogLineConnection {
  edges: [AppLogLineEdge] @critical
  nodes: [AppLogLine] @nicetohave
  pageInfo: PageInfo! @critical

  # TODO: figure out how to make this a hydrated metadata   #NOT_IN_NADEL
  """
  Metadata about the function invocation (applies to all log lines of invocation)
  """
  metadata: FunctionInvocationMetadata!
}

"""
AppLogLines returned from AppLog query.

Not quite a Relay-style Connection since you can't page from this query.
"""
type AppLogLines {
  edges: [AppLogLineEdge] @critical
  nodes: [AppLogLine] @nicetohave
  pageInfo: PageInfo! @critical
}

"""
Relay-style Edge to an `AppLogLine` object.
"""
type AppLogLineEdge {
  node: AppLogLine! @critical
  cursor: String! @critical
}

type AppLogLine {
  """
  Time the log line was issued

  RFC-3339 formatted timestamp
  """
  timestamp: String!

  """
  Log level of log line.  Typically one of:
  TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL
  """
  level: String

  """
  The free-form textual message from the log statement.
  """
  message: String

  """
  We really don't know what other fields may be in the logs.

  This field may be an array or an object.

  If it's an object, it will include only fields in `includeFields`,
  unless `includeFields` is null, in which case it will include
  all fields that are not in `excludeFields`.

  If it's an array it will include the entire array.
  """
  other: JSON
}

type DeveloperLogAccessResult {
  """Indicates whether developer has access to logs"""
  developerHasAccess: Boolean!

  """Site ARI"""
  contextId: ID!
}

type InstallationContextWithLogAccess {
  """
  Installation context as an ARI
  """
  installationContext: ID!

  """
  Cloud id extracted from the context id. Only populated if context id is a valid cloud context.
  """
  cloudId: ID

  #NADEL """
  #NADEL The tenant context for the cloud id. Only populated if context id is a valid cloud context.
  #NADEL """
  #NADEL tenantContext: TenantContext => hydrated from tcs.tenantContexts(cloudIds: $source.cloudId) object identified by cloudId, batch size 90
}
roadmaps:
type Query {
    roadmaps: RoadmapsQuery
}

type Mutation {
    # Setup a roadmap on a project
    # Adds any project configuration required to support roadmaps
    setupRoadmap(input: SetupRoadmapInput) : SetupRoadmapOutput

    # Add a roadmap dependency
    addRoadmapDependency(input: RoadmapDependencyInput): RoadmapDependencyOutput

    # Remove a roadmap dependency
    removeRoadmapDependency(input: RoadmapDependencyInput): RoadmapDependencyOutput

    # Enable or disable the roadmap feature
    toggleRoadmapFeature(input: RoadmapFeatureToggleInput): RoadmapFeatureToggleOutput

    # Add a roadmap item
    addRoadmapItem(input: RoadmapItemCreateInput, sourceARI: ID): AddRoadmapItemResponse

    # Update a roadmap item
    updateRoadmapItem(input: RoadmapItemUpdateInput): UpdateRoadmapItemResponse

    # Schedule roadmap items
    scheduleRoadmapItems(input: RoadmapScheduleItemsInput): ScheduleRoadmapItemsResponse
}

# Types of changes that can be made to roadmaps
enum RoadmapChangeType {
    # Project was created
    PROJECT_CREATED
    # Item created
    ISSUE_CREATED
    # Date modified on an item
    DATE
    # Item reranked
    RANK
    # Summary updated on an item
    SUMMARY
    # Description updated on an item
    DESCRIPTION
    # Unknown change was made
    UNKNOWN
}

# A change that has been applied to a roadmap
type RoadmapChange {
    # The time that the last change was made in millis utc
    timestamp: Float
    # The time that the last change was made in RFC 3339 format
    changeTimestamp: DateTime
    # The user who made the change
    username: String
    # The item that was involved in the latest change
    itemTitle: String
    # The type of change that occurred
    type: RoadmapChangeType
}

# Information about the type of a roadmap Item
type RoadmapItemType {
    # The identifier of this item type
    id: ID!,
    # A description of this item type
    description: String,
    # The url for the icon of the item type
    iconUrl: String,
    # The display name of the item type
    name: String,
    # Whether this item type represents a subtask
    subtask: Boolean!,
    # The avatar for this item type
    avatarId: ID,
    # Fields that are required for this item type
    requiredFieldIds: [ID!]
}

# Information about the permissions available for the roadmap project for the current user
type RoadmapProjectPermissions {
    # can issues be edited
    editIssues: Boolean! @deprecated(reason: "Use the version prefixed with 'can' instead"),
    # can issues be scheduled
    scheduleIssues: Boolean! @deprecated(reason: "Use the version prefixed with 'can' instead"),
    # can issues be created
    createIssues: Boolean! @deprecated(reason: "Use the version prefixed with 'can' instead"),
    # can the project be administered
    administerProjects: Boolean! @deprecated(reason: "Use the version prefixed with 'can' instead"),
    # can issues be edited
    canEditIssues: Boolean!,
    # can issues be scheduled
    canScheduleIssues: Boolean!,
    # can issues be created
    canCreateIssues: Boolean!,
    # can the project be administered
    canAdministerProjects: Boolean!
}

# Details about how valid the roadmap project is
type RoadmapProjectValidation {
    # Are all the field associations correct for the project
    hasAllFieldAssociations: Boolean!,
    # Has the epic issue type been setup
    hasEpicIssueType: Boolean!,
    # Is the hierarchy for the project in a valid state
    hasValidHierarchy: Boolean!
    # Is roadmap feature enabled in the project
    isRoadmapFeatureEnabled: Boolean! @deprecated(reason: "Use the value from RoadmapDetails if possible"),
}

# Details of a project for a roadmap
type RoadmapProject {
    # The identifier of the project
    id: ID!,
    # The short key of the project i.e. ABC
    key: String,
    # The display name of the project
    name: String,
    # The description of the project
    description: String,
    # The user who is leading the project
    lead: JiraUser,
    # Has the current user completed onboarding
    hasCompletedOnboarding: Boolean!,
    # Does this project support dependencies between issues
    areDependenciesSupported: Boolean!,
    # The description for inward dependency links
    inwardDependencyDescription: String,
    # The description for outward dependency links
    outwardDependencyDescription: String,
    # The issue type for epic, in future this will be replaced by using the hierarchy structures directly
    epicIssueTypeId: ID,
    # Start date custom field ID; used to resolve raw fields data in Bento optimistic updates
    startDateCustomFieldId: ID,
    # Color custom field ID; used to resolve raw fields data in Bento optimistic updates
    colorCustomFieldId: ID,
    # Lexo rank custom field ID; used in all ranking operations, in future should be replaced by mutations
    lexoRankCustomFieldId: ID,
    # The types of items that this project has
    itemTypes: [RoadmapItemType!],
    # Permissions for the project
    permissions: RoadmapProjectPermissions,
    # Validation details for the project
    validation: RoadmapProjectValidation
}

# Details of the category that a status belongs to
type RoadmapItemStatusCategory {
    id: ID!,
    key: String!,
    name: String,
}

# Details of the status an item has
type RoadmapItemStatus {
    id: ID!,
    name: String,
    statusCategory: RoadmapItemStatusCategory,
}

# The roadmap item data
type RoadmapItem implements Node {
    # The ID of this item
    id: ID!
    # The id of the project for this item
    projectId: ID!,
    # The key of this item
    key: String!
    # The type of this item
    itemType: RoadmapItemType!
    # The ID of the parent
    parentId: ID
    # The summary of this item
    summary: String
    # The assignee of this item
    assignee: JiraUser
    # When this item is due, note this is a Date with no TZ
    dueDate: Date
    # When this item is set to start, note this is a Date with no TZ
    startDate: Date
    # The status of this item
    status: RoadmapItemStatus,
    # The status category of this item
    statusCategory: RoadmapItemStatusCategory
    # When this item was created
    createdDate: DateTime
    # When this item was resolved
    resolutionDate: DateTime
    # IDs of RoadmapItem dependencies for this item
    dependencies: [ID!]
    # What color should be shown for this item
    color: PaletteColor
    # Lexorank value for the issue (used to determine issues ranking when receiving update events)
    rank: String
    # List of labels on this item
    labels: [String!]
    # List of ids of the versions on this item
    versionIds: [ID!]
    # List of sprint ids that exist on the item
    sprintIds: [ID!]
    # List of ids of the components on this item
    componentIds: [ID!]
    # The due date inferred from any child items, note this is a Date with no TZ
    inferredDueDate: Date
    # The start date inferred from any child items, note this is a Date with no TZ
    inferredStartDate: Date
}

# Relay edge definition for a roadmap item
type RoadmapItemEdge {
    # Cursor position for this edge
    cursor: String!
    # The roadmap item for this edge
    node: RoadmapItem
}

# Relay connection definition for a roadmap item
type RoadmapItemConnection {
    # The edges for this connection
    edges: [RoadmapItemEdge]!
    # The nodes for this connection
    nodes: [RoadmapItem]!
    # Details about this page
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

# Details of the roadmap status category
type RoadmapStatusCategory {
    id: ID!,
    key: String!,
    name: String!,
}

# Details about dependency configuration for roadmaps
type RoadmapDependencyConfiguration {
    # Are dependencies enabled
    dependenciesEnabled: Boolean!,
    # The description to apply for inbound dependencies
    inwardDependencyDescription: String,
    # The descripto to apply for outbound dependencies
    outwardDependencyDescription: String
}

# Configuration values for the external system(s) behind the roadmap data
type RoadmapExternalConfiguration {
    # ID of external system
    externalSystem: ID!,
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents color in the external system
    colorFields: [ID],
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents start date in the external system
    startDateField: ID
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents due date in the external system
    dueDateField: ID,
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents rank in the external system
    rankField: ID
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents epic link in the external system
    epicLinkField: ID
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents epic name in the external system
    epicNameField: ID
    # The identifier for the 'field' that represents sprint in the external system
    sprintField: ID
}

# A required field of an issue type
type RequiredField {
    # The unique id of the field
    id: ID!,
    # The type of the field, e.g. string, number, boolean, etc.
    type: String!
}

# Details of a version
type RoadmapVersion {
    # A unique identifier for the version
    id: ID!
    # The name of the version
    name: String!,
    # The status of the version
    status: RoadmapVersionStatus!
}

# Avaliable version statuses
enum RoadmapVersionStatus {
    # version has been released
    RELEASED
    # version has not been released
    UNRELEASED
    # version has been archived
    ARCHIVED
}

# Details of a component
type RoadmapComponent {
    # A unique identifier for the component
    id: ID!
    # The name of the component
    name: String!
}

# Configuration details specific to a project
type RoadmapProjectConfiguration {
    # The identifier of the project
    projectId: ID!,
    # The short key of the project i.e. ABC
    projectKey: String,
    # The name of the project i.e. ABC project
    projectName: String,
    # All required fields from issue types belong to this project
    requiredFields: [RequiredField!]!,
    # The item types at the parent level
    parentItemTypes: [RoadmapItemType!]!,
    # The item types at the child level
    childItemTypes: [RoadmapItemType!]!,
    # Permission details for this project
    permissions: RoadmapProjectPermissions,
    # Validation information for this project
    validation: RoadmapProjectValidation,
    # The id of the default item type
    defaultItemTypeId: String
    # List of versions for this project
    versions: [RoadmapVersion!]
    # List of components for this project
    components: [RoadmapComponent!]
}

# View settings for epics on the roadmap
enum EpicView {
    # All epics regardless of status
    ALL
    # Epics with status complete
    COMPLETED
    # Epics with status incomplete
    INCOMPLETE
}

# View settings for hierarchy level one items on the roadmap
enum RoadmapLevelOneView {
    # Show level one items completed within last 12 months
    COMPLETE12M
    # Show level one items completed within last 9 months
    COMPLETE9M
    # Show level one items completed within last 6 months
    COMPLETE6M
    # Show level one items completed within last 3 months
    COMPLETE3M
    # Show level one items completed within last 1 month
    COMPLETE1M
    # Do not show completed level one items
    INCOMPLETE
}

# Defines the available timeline modes
enum TimelineMode {
    # Weeks
    WEEKS
    # Months
    MONTHS
    # Quarters
    QUARTERS
}

# States that a sprint can be in
enum RoadmapSprintState {
    # A sprint that was completed in the past
    CLOSED
    # A current sprint
    ACTIVE
    # A sprint that is planned for the future
    FUTURE
}

# Any user specific configuration for the roadmap
type RoadmapUserConfiguration {
    # Has the current user completed onboarding
    hasCompletedOnboarding: Boolean! @deprecated(reason: "Legacy onboarding being replaced"),
    # Issue Creation Preferences
    creationPreferences: CreationPreferences!,
    # Should dependencies be visible in Roadmaps UI
    isDependenciesVisible: Boolean!,
    # Should progress be visible in Roadmaps UI
    isProgressVisible: Boolean!,
    # List Component width in UI
    listWidth: Long!,
    # Timeline View - WEEKS, MONTHS or QUARTERS
    timeline: String! @deprecated(reason: "Use the 'timelineMode' instead"),
    # Timeline View - WEEKS, MONTHS or QUARTERS
    timelineMode: TimelineMode!
    # Epic View - ALL, COMPLETED, INCOMPLETE
    epicView: EpicView!
    # View settings for hierarchy level one items on the roadmap
    levelOneView: RoadmapLevelOneView!
}

# Board related configuration
type RoadmapBoardConfiguration {
    # Board's JQL
    jql: String
    # Is the current user a board admin
    isUserBoardAdmin: Boolean
    # sprints owned by the board associated to the roadmap
    sprints: [RoadmapSprint!]
    # Is the board's jql filtering out epics
    isBoardJqlFilteringOutEpics: Boolean
    # Is the sprints feature enabled on the board
    isSprintsFeatureEnabled: Boolean
}

type RoadmapSprint {
    # A unique identifier for the sprint
    id: ID!
    # The name of the sprint
    name: String!,
    # The start date of the sprint
    startDate: Date!,
    # The end date of the sprint
    endDate: Date!,
    # The state of the sprint
    state: RoadmapSprintState!
}

type CreationPreferences {
    projectId: Long,
    itemTypes: JSON!
}

type RoadmapConfiguration {
    # Is this roadmap cross project
    isCrossProject: Boolean!,
    # Is the roadmap feature enabled for this roadmap
    roadmapFeatureEnabled: Boolean!,
    # Is the board backed with jql with Rank ASC in order by clause
    rankIssuesSupported: Boolean!,
    # Dependency configuration for this roadmap
    dependencies: RoadmapDependencyConfiguration,
    # External configuration details
    externalConfiguration: RoadmapExternalConfiguration,
    # Project information
    projectConfigurations: [RoadmapProjectConfiguration!]!,
    # Details of status categories
    statusCategories: [RoadmapStatusCategory!]!
    # Configuration specific to the current user
    userConfiguration: RoadmapUserConfiguration,
    # Configuration specific to the roadmap board
    boardConfiguration: RoadmapBoardConfiguration,
}

type RoadmapMetadata {
    # has the roadmap exceeded the epic limit
    hasExceededEpicLimit: Boolean!,
    # has the roadmap exceeded the overall limit of issues (epic + issues)
    hasExceededIssueLimit: Boolean!,
    # how many corrupted issues have we found while loading the roadmap
    corruptedIssueCount: Int!
}

type RoadmapExternalField {
    # 'id' of the field that the UI understands
    id: ID!,
    # the value of the field i.e. the jira custom field id
    value: String
}

# Details of a roadmap
type RoadmapDetails {
    # The configuration for this roadmap
    roadmapConfiguration: RoadmapConfiguration,
    # The items in the roadmap
    roadmapItems: RoadmapItemConnection,
    # meta information surrounding the roadmap, such as issue limit breaches
    metadata: RoadmapMetadata
}

# top level type for grouping, because of the wiring we are moving to use RoadmapsQuery instead
type RoadmapQuery {
    # Get the most recent change for a roadmap
    roadmapChange: RoadmapChange
    # Get the project details for a roadmap
    roadmapProject: RoadmapProject
    # Get a single item
    roadmapItemById(id :ID!): RoadmapItem
    # Get the items for a roadmap
    roadmapItems(includeChildren: Boolean): RoadmapItemConnection
    # Get status categories for a roadmap
    roadmapStatusCategories: [RoadmapStatusCategory]!
}

# top level grouping of potential roadmap queries
type RoadmapsQuery {
    # Lookup details of a roadmap, isClassicDarkTraffic should be set to true for classic dark traffic this will be cleanup after GA.
    roadmapForSource(sourceARI: ID!, locationARI: ID, isClassicDarkTraffic: Boolean): RoadmapDetails
    # _Deprecated Get a single item
    roadmapItemById(id :ID!): RoadmapItem
    # Get multiple items
    roadmapItemByIds(sourceARI: ID!, ids: [ID!]!): [RoadmapItem]
}

# Input for setting up a project with a roadmap
input SetupRoadmapInput {
    # The numeric id of project that is being configured
    projectId: ID!
    # The name of the epic type, if this is not provided then a default name will be used. This is ignored if
    # promoteItemTypeId is provided.
    epicTypeName: String
    # The description of the epic type, if this is not provided then a default description will be used.
    # This is ignored if promoteItemTypeId is provided.
    epicTypeDescription: String
    # The numeric id of the item type that will be promoted to epic, if this is provided then the existing item
    # type will be used and epicTypeName and epicTypeDescription are ignored
    promoteItemTypeId: ID
}

type SetupRoadmapOutput {
    # There is no response from setup, status code indicates success / failure
    # This value is just reflecting back the supplied projectId from the query to give graphql something to
    # ask for
    projectId: ID!
}

# Input of a roadmap dependecy mutation.
input RoadmapDependencyInput {
    # "dependee" requires/depends on "dependency"
    dependee: ID!
    # "dependency" is required/depended on by "dependee"
    dependency: ID!
}

# Output of a roadmap dependency mutation.
type RoadmapDependencyOutput {
    # "dependee" requires/depends on "dependency"
    dependee: ID!
    # "dependency" is required/depended on by "dependee"
    dependency: ID!
}

# Input to toggle roadmap feature
input RoadmapFeatureToggleInput {
    # source ARI of the roadmap to enable/disable
    sourceARI: ID!,
    # indicates to enable or disable the roadmap
    enabled: Boolean!
}

# Output of the toggle roadmap mutation
type RoadmapFeatureToggleOutput {
    # indicates if the roadmap is enabled or not
    enabled: Boolean!
    # indicates if the roadmap is cross project or not
    isCrossProject: Boolean!
}

# Input of a roadmap create item rank operation
# Ranking is limited to `beforeId` only due to a limitations in Jira API
input RoadmapCreateItemRank {
    # Rank before ID; used only to rank the item before the input item ID
    beforeId: ID,
}

# Input of a roadmap update item rank operation
input RoadmapUpdateItemRank {
    # Rank before ID; used only to rank the item before the input item ID
    beforeId: ID,
    # Rank after ID; used only to rank the item after the input item ID
    afterId: ID,
}

# Input of a roadmap add item mutation.
input RoadmapItemCreateInput {
    # Roadmap project ID; used only to fetch custom fields and won't have any impact on the item itself
    projectId: ID!,
    # The type of this item
    itemTypeId: ID!
    # The ID of the parent
    parentId: ID
    # The summary of this item
    summary: String!
    # When this item is due; date in RFC3339 DateTime format
    dueDate: Date
    # When this item is set to start; date in RFC3339 DateTime format
    startDate: Date
    # What color should be shown for this item
    color: PaletteColor,
    # Item rank request
    rank: RoadmapCreateItemRank,
    # Jql of the board the issue is being created for
    jql: String
    # List of labels to be added to the newly created issue.
    labels: [String!]
    # AccountId of the assignee.
    assignee: String
    # List of version ids to be added to the newly created issue.
    versionIds: [ID!]
    # List of component ids to be added to the newly created issue.
    componentIds: [ID!]
    # Mutation ID defined by client
    clientMutationId: ID,
}

# Input of a roadmap update item mutation.
input RoadmapItemUpdateInput {
    # Roadmap item ID
    itemId: ID!
    # Roadmap project ID; used only to fetch custom fields and won't have any impact on the item itself
    projectId: ID!,
    # The summary of this item
    summary: String
    # When this item is due; date in RFC3339 DateTime format
    dueDate: Date
    # When this item is set to start; date in RFC3339 DateTime format
    startDate: Date
    # What color should be shown for this item
    color: PaletteColor
    # Item rank request
    rank: RoadmapUpdateItemRank,
    # Mutation ID defined by client
    clientMutationId: ID,
    # When this is true, start date value will be cleared
    # _Deprecated_ Use "clearFields" instead
    clearStartDate: Boolean,
    # When this is true, due date value will be cleared
    # _Deprecated_ Use "clearFields" instead
    clearDueDate: Boolean,
    # The id of the parent of the issue
    parentId: ID,
    # Sprint id of the roadmap item
    sprintId: ID,
    # When this is true the sprint will be cleared
    # _Deprecated_ Use "clearFields" instead
    clearSprint: Boolean,
    # Field to be cleared; clearFields take precedence over other field input
    clearFields: [String!]
}

type AddRoadmapItemResponse implements MutationResponse {
    # Mutation error code
    # 200 - success
    # 500 - bad response from Jira
    # 400 - project is not configured
    statusCode: Int!,
    # _Deprecated_ according to the graphql standard, we should be using statusCode instead
    # see https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GRAPHQL/pages/413770807/Mutation
    code: Int!
    # Mutation response message
    message: String!,
    # Mutation ID defined by client
    clientMutationId: ID,
    # Success flag; equals true if mutation was successful
    success: Boolean!,
    # Roadmap item
    item: RoadmapItem,
    # Determines if the created issue matches the jql of the current board
    matchesSource: Boolean!
}

type UpdateRoadmapItemResponse implements MutationResponse {
    # Mutation error code
    # 200 - success
    # 500 - bad response from Jira
    # 400 - project is not configured
    statusCode: Int!
    # _Deprecated_ according to the graphql standard, we should be using statusCode instead
    # see https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GRAPHQL/pages/413770807/Mutation
    code: Int!
    # Mutation response message
    message: String!,
    # Mutation ID defined by client
    clientMutationId: ID,
    # Success flag; equals true if mutation was successful
    success: Boolean!,
    # Roadmap item
    item: RoadmapItem @deprecated(reason: "No longer returned in response")
}

# Input for a single roadmap schedule item.
input RoadmapItemScheduleInput {
    # Roadmap item ID
    itemId: ID!
    # When this item is due; date in RFC3339 DateTime format
    dueDate: Date
    # When this item is set to start; date in RFC3339 DateTime format
    startDate: Date
}

# Input of a roadmap schedule items mutation.
input RoadmapScheduleItemsInput {
    # List of schedule requests
    scheduleRequests: [RoadmapItemScheduleInput]!
    # Mutation ID defined by client
    clientMutationId: ID,
}


type ScheduleRoadmapItemsResponse implements MutationResponse {
    # Mutation error code
    # 200 - success
    # 500 - bad response from Jira
    # 400 - project is not configured
    statusCode: Int!
    # Mutation response message
    message: String!,
    # Mutation ID defined by client
    clientMutationId: ID,
    # Success flag; equals true if mutation was successful
    success: Boolean!,
}

### Mutations ###

interface MutationResponse {
    statusCode: Int!
    success: Boolean!
    message: String!
    clientMutationId: ID
}

### Common Jira Schema types ###

### Jira user context ###

# The various sizes of avatar urls that are supported, see https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/packages/core/avatar
type AvatarUrls {
    # A 16 by 16 avatar
    xsmall: String
    # A 24 by 24 avatar
    small: String
    # A 32 by 32 avatar
    medium: String
    # A 48 by 48 avatar
    large: String
}

# Jira's representation of a user.  distinct from identites representation.  _Subject to change with GDPR work_
type JiraUser {
    # ID for the user generated by swag.  This is not an AAID or Jira user ID.  This field will change in the future.
    id: ID

    # User's account id
    accountId: String

    # User's name
    name: String

    # Name to display for the user when rendering
    displayName: String

    # The time zone the user has configured for themselves
    timeZone: String

    # Default avatar URL to use when rendering the user
    avatarUrl: String

    # Alternative avatar urls for different sizes
    avatarUrls: AvatarUrls
}

# Supported colors in the Palette
enum PaletteColor {
    PURPLE,
    BLUE,
    GREEN,
    TEAL,
    YELLOW,
    ORANGE,
    GREY,
    DARK_PURPLE,
    DARK_BLUE,
    DARK_GREEN,
    DARK_TEAL,
    DARK_YELLOW,
    DARK_ORANGE,
    DARK_GREY
}


### Scalars

#RFC3339 format
scalar DateTime
scalar Date

scalar JSON
scalar Long


# Standard relay pagination structure
type PageInfo {
    # Whether there is there a next page
    hasNextPage: Boolean!
    # Whether there is a previous page
    hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
    # The start of this page
    startCursor: String
    # The end of this page
    endCursor: String
}

# Standard Relay node interface
interface Node {
    # The id of the node
    id: ID!
}

type Query {

    """
    This is a cursor after which (exclusive) the data should be fetched from
    """
    after: String

    """This is an int that says to fetch the first N items"""
    first: Int = 10
    filter: ContentPlatformReleaseNoteFilterOptions
    publishedOnly: Boolean = true
    orderBy: String = "publishDate"
  ): ContentPlatformReleaseNotesConnection!
  releaseNote(
    """The Contentful ID of the target release note"""
    id: String!

    """Whether to include published items only"""
    publishedOnly: Boolean
  ): ContentPlatformReleaseNote

  practicePage(
    """The Contentful ID of the target Practice Page"""
    id: String!
  ): ContentPlatformPracticePage!
}

  """

  """
  A list of Feature Delivery Jira issue keys on which to match release notes
  """

  """A list of Change Types on which to match release notes"""

  """A list of product/app names on which to match release notes"""

  """A list of change statuses on which to match release notes"""

  """A list of feature flag off values on which to match release notes"""
  releaseNoteFlagOffValues: [String!]

  """A list of publish statuses on which to match release notes"""
  publishStatus: [String!]
}

    """Feature flag"""

    """Feature flag off value"""
    releaseNoteFlagOffValue: String = ""

    """Announcement Plan"""

    """Products this Release note applies to"""

    """Product IDs for products this Release note applies to"""

    """Short description"""
    description: JSON!

    """Change Category"""

    """Benefits list"""

type Activities {

    """
    get all activity
    - filters - query filters for the activity stream
    - first - show 1st <N> items of the response
    """
    all(filters: [ActivitiesFilter!], first: Int, after: String): ActivitiesConnection!

    """
    get "Worked on" activity
    - filters - query filters for the activity stream
    - first - show 1st <N> items of the response
    """
    workedOn(filters: [ActivitiesFilter!], first: Int, after: String): ActivitiesConnection!

    """
    get activity about the currently logged in user
    """
    myActivities: MyActivities

    """
    get the activities objects for the given ids
    """
    nodes(ids: [ID!]): [ActivitiesObject]
}

type MyActivities {

    """
    get all my activity
    - filters - query filters for the activity stream
    - first - show 1st <N> items of the response
    """
    all(filters: [ActivitiesFilter!], first: Int, after: String): ActivitiesConnection

    """
    get my "worked on" activity
    - filters - query filters for the activity stream
    - first - show 1st <N> items of the response
    """
    workedOn(filters: [ActivitiesFilter!], first: Int, after: String): ActivitiesConnection

    """
    get my "viewed" activity
    - filters - query filters for the activity stream
    - first - show 1st <N> items of the response
    """
    viewed(filters: [ActivitiesFilter!], first: Int, after: String): ActivitiesConnection

    """
    get the activities objects for the given ids
    """
    nodes(ids: [ID!]): [ActivitiesObject]
}

input ActivitiesFilter {

    """
    Defines relationship in-between filter arguments (AND/OR)
    """
    type: ActivitiesFilterType

    arguments: ActivitiesArguments

}

input ActivitiesArguments {

    """
    set of Atlassian account IDs
    """
    accountIds: [ID!]

    """
    set of Cloud IDs
    """
    cloudIds: [ID!]

    """
    set of products
    """
    products: [ActivityProduct!]

    """
    set of Event Types
    """
    eventTypes: [ActivityEventType!]

    """
    set of Object Types
    """
    objectTypes: [ActivitiesObjectType!]

    """
    arbitrary transition filters
    """
    transitions: [ActivityTransition!]

    """
    set of Container IDs
    """
    containerIds: [ID!]

    """
    The creation time of the earliest events to be included in the result
    """
    earliestStart: DateTime

    """
    The creation time of the latest events to be included in the result
    """
    latestStart: DateTime
}

type ActivityEdge {

    cursor : String!

    node : ActivitiesItem
}

type ActivitiesConnection {

    edges: [ActivityEdge]

    nodes: [ActivitiesItem!]!

    pageInfo : ActivityPageInfo!
}

type ActivitiesItem implements Node {

    """
    Base64 encoded ARI of the activity.
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    ISO 8601
    """
    timestamp: String

    object: ActivitiesObject

}

type ActivitiesObject implements Node {

    """
    Base64 encoded ARI of the object.
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    Local (in product) object ID of the corresponding object.
    """
    localResourceId: ID

    name: String

    type: ActivityObjectType

    product: ActivityProduct

    cloudId: String

    url: String

    iconUrl: String

    """
    Hierarchy of the containers, top container comes first
    """
    containers: [ActivitiesContainer!]

    contributors: [ActivitiesContributor!]

    parent: ActivitiesObjectParent

    events(first: Int): [ActivitiesEvent!]

    extension: ActivitiesObjectExtension

}

union ActivitiesObjectExtension = ActivitiesJiraIssue

"""
Extension of ActivitiesObject, is a part of ActivitiesObjectExtension union
"""
type ActivitiesJiraIssue {

    issueKey: String

}

    ISO 8601

    extension: ActivitiesEventExtension

}

    profile: ActivityUser

}

type ActivitiesObjectParent {

    """
    Base64 encoded ARI of the object.
    """
    id: ID!

    type: ActivityObjectType

}

    SPACE

    TASK
    GOAL
}

enum ActivityProduct {

type Activity {

    all(filter: ActivityFilter, first: Int, after: String): ActivityConnection!

    """
    Worked On: includes actions like CREATED, UPDATED, COMMENTED, etc.
    """
    workedOn(filter: ActivityFilter, first: Int, after: String): ActivityConnection!

    myActivity: MyActivity

}

type MyActivity {

    all(filter: MyActivityFilter, first: Int, after: String): ActivityConnection!

    workedOn(filter: MyActivityFilter, first: Int, after: String): ActivityConnection!

    viewed(filter: MyActivityFilter, first: Int, after: String): ActivityConnection!
}

input ActivityFilter {

    """
    set of actor ARIs whose activity should be searched (ex: AAIDs)
    """
    actors: [ID!]

    """
    Defines relationship between the filter arguments. Default: AND
    """
    type: ActivitiesFilterType

    """
    These are always AND-ed with accountIds
    """
    arguments: ActivityFilterArgs

}

input MyActivityFilter {

    """
    Defines relationship between the filter arguments. Default: AND
    """
    type: ActivitiesFilterType

    arguments: ActivityFilterArgs

}

input ActivityFilterArgs {

    """
    set of top-level container ARIs (ex: Cloud ID, workspace ID)
    """
    rootContainerIds: [ID!]

    """
    set of products (derived from the resource ARI)
    ex:
        jira
        confluence
        townsquare
    """
    products: [String!]

    """
    set of Event Types
    ex:
        assigned
        unassigned
        viewed
        updated
        created
        liked
        transitioned
        published
        edited
    """
    eventTypes: [String!]

    """
    set of Object Types (derived from the resource ARI)
    ex:
        issue
        page
        blogpost
        comment
        project (townsquare)
        goal
    """
    objectTypes: [String!]

    """
    arbitrary transition filters
    """
    transitions: [ActivityTransition!]

    """
    set of Container IDs (ex: Jira project ID, Space ID, etc)
    """
    containerIds: [ID!]

    """
    The creation time of the earliest events to be included in the result
    """
    earliestStart: DateTime

    """
    The creation time of the latest events to be included in the result
    """
    latestStart: DateTime
}

    jiraProjectRelationshipsForRepository(

        cloudId: ID!,
        first: Int = 20,
        after: String,
        filter: JiraProjectAndRepositoryRelationshipFilterInput,
        sort: JiraProjectAndRepositoryRelationshipSortInput): JiraProjectAndRepositoryRelationshipConnection

}

type JiraProjectAndRepositoryRelationship implements EntityProperties & HistorySummary & InferenceHistory &  Node {
    """The ARI of this relationship."""
    id: ID!

    The revision must be provided when updating a relationship to prevent
    simultaneous updates from overwriting each other.

    revision: ID!

    jiraProjectId: ID!

    """If the repository provider is Bitbucket, this will contain its ARI, otherwise null."""
    bitbucketRepositoryId: ID

    """If the repository provider is a third party, this will contain the repository details, otherwise null."""
    thirdPartyRepository: ThirdPartyRepository

    """An optional description of the relationship."""
    description: String

    """Whether the relationship is explicit or inferred."""
    certainty: RelationshipCertainty!

    """Who created the relationship."""
    createdBy: String!

    """When the relationship was created."""
    createdAt: DateTime!

    """Who updated the relationship last. Only present for relationships that have been updated."""
    lastUpdatedBy: String

    """When the relationship was updated last.  Only present for relationships that have been updated."""
    lastUpdatedAt: DateTime

    """Who inferred the relationship last. Only present for implicit relationships."""
    lastInferredBy: String

    """When the relationship was inferred last. Only present for implicit relationships."""
    lastInferredAt: DateTime

    """Look up JSON properties of the relationship by keys."""
    properties(keys:[String!]!): JSON
}

type Query {
    """
    The search method serves as an entry point to the various results across multiple Atlassian products.
    This method proxy to Search Platform's API xpsearch-aggregator.
    It supports multi tenant search with product specific filtering.
    """
    search: SearchQueryAPI
}

"""
Entry point for all searches
"""
type SearchQueryAPI {

    """
    Searches for some entities
    """
    search(

        """
        Query to search
        """
        query: String

        """
        This object determines the tenants/locations where the search should be performed.
        It also determines the kind of results which must be returned.

        As this supports multiple products and each products have different set of filters.
        The implementation is split by the product.
        """
        filters: SearchFilterInput

        """
        Contains metadata on any analytics related fields, these do not affect the search
        """
        analytics: SearchAnalyticsInput

        """
        String describing which experience the search is being called from, e.g. confluence.advanced_search
        """
        experience: String!

        """
        Used to determine the result size
        """
        first: Int

    ): SearchItemConnection!
}



"""
Metadata on any analytics related fields, these do not affect the search
"""
input SearchAnalyticsInput {
    queryVersion: Int
    searchSessionId: String
    searchReferrerId: String
}

    hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
    startCursor: String!
    endCursor: String
}

    The search result object, this is a union type of all possible search result types.
    A different definition will be provided for all entities supported by Atlassian
    """
    node: SearchResult

    """
    Opaque string containing the cursor for this edge
    """
    cursor: String

}

type SearchItemConnection {
    """
    The search result items as per pagination specs
    """
    edges: [SearchResultItemEdge!]!

    """
    The page info as per pagination specs
    """
    pageInfo: PageInfo!

    """

    """
    totalCount: Int
}

  """
  The `WAS NOT IN` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field has never been one of multiple specified values.

  WAS_NOT_IN
  """
  The `CHANGED` operator is used to find issues that have a value that had changed for the specified field.

  CHANGED
  """
  The `WAS IN` operator is used to find issues that currently have or previously had any of multiple specified values for the specified field.
  """
  WAS_IN
  """
  The `WAS` operator is used to find issues that currently have or previously had the specified value for the specified field.

  WAS

"""
Cascading options can either be a parent or a child - this enum captures this characteristic.

E.g. If there is a parent cascading option named `P1`, it may or may not have
child cascading options named `C1` and `C2`.
- `P1` would be a `PARENT` enum
- `C1` and `C2` would be `CHILD` enums
"""
enum JiraCascadingSelectOptionType {
  """
  Parent option only
  """
  PARENT
  """
  Child option only
  """
  CHILD
  """
  All options, regardless of whether they're a parent or child.
  """
  ALL
}

    """

    List of issues with the version.
    """

        """
        The number of items after the cursor to be returned in a forward page.
        If not specified, it is up to the server to determine a page size.
        """
        first: Int
        """
        The index based cursor to specify the beginning of the items.
        If not specified it's assumed as the cursor for the item before the beginning.
        """
        after: String
        """
        The number of items before the cursor to be returned in a backward page.
        If not specified, it is up to the server to determine a page size.
        """
        last: Int
        """
        The index based cursor to specify the bottom limit of the items.
        If not specified it's assumed as the cursor to the item after the last item.
        """
        before: String
        """
        filter of the issues under this version. If not given, the default filter will be determined by the server
        """
        filter: JiraVersionIssuesFilter = ALL
    ): JiraIssueConnection
}

extend type JiraQuery {
    """
    Retrieves application properties for the given instance.

    Returns an array containing application properties for each of the provided keys. If a matching application property
    cannot be found, then no entry is added to the array for that key.

    A maximum of 50 keys can be provided. If the limit is exceeded then then an error may be returned.
    """
    applicationPropertiesByKey(cloudId: ID!, keys: [String!]!): [JiraApplicationProperty!]
}

"""
Jira application properties is effectively a key/value store scoped to a Jira instance. A JiraApplicationProperty
represents one of these key/value pairs, along with associated metadata about the property.
"""
type JiraApplicationProperty implements Node {
    """
    Globally unique identifier
    """
    id: ID!,

    """
    The unique key of the application property
    """
    key: String!,

    """
    Although all application properties are stored as strings, they notionally have a type (e.g. boolean, int, enum,
    string). The type can be anything (for example, there is even a colour type), and there may be associated validation
    on the server based on the property's type.
    """
    type: String!,

    """

        before: String
        "The mandatory grant type key to search within specific grant type such as project role."
        grantTypeKey: JiraGrantTypeKeyEnum!
        "search term to filter down on the grant type values."
        searchTerm: String
        "The cloud id of the tenant."

    """

    """

    The project objects will be returned based on implicit ascending order by project name.

    getProjectsByPermissionScheme(
        "Returns the first n elements from the list."
        first: Int
        "Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor."
        after: String
        "Returns the last n elements from the list."
        last: Int
        "Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor."
        before: String
        "The permission scheme ARI to filter the results."

        "Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor."
        after: String
        "Returns the last n elements from the list."
        last: Int
        "Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor."
        before: String
        "The permission scheme ARI to filter the results."
        schemeId: ID!
        "The optional project permission key to filter the results."
        permissionKey: String
    ): JiraPermissionGrantValueConnection @deprecated(reason: "Please use getPermissionSchemeGrants instead.")

    """
    A list of paginated permission scheme grants based on the given permission scheme ID and permission key.
    """
    getPermissionSchemeGrants(
        "Returns the first n elements from the list."
        first: Int
        "Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor."
        after: String
        "Returns the last n elements from the list."
        last: Int
        "Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor."
        before: String
        "The permission scheme ARI to filter the results."
        schemeId: ID!
        "The mandatory project permission key to filter the results."
        permissionKey: String!
        "The optional grant type key to filter the results."
        grantTypeKey: JiraGrantTypeKeyEnum
    ): JiraPermissionGrantConnection

    """
    Gets the permission scheme grants hierarchy (by grant type key) based on the given permission scheme ID and permission key.
    This returns a bounded list of data with limit set to 50. For getting the complete list in paginated manner, use getPermissionSchemeGrants.
    """

"""
The grant type key enum represents all the possible grant types available in Jira.
A grant type may take an optional parameter value.
For example: PROJECT_ROLE grant type takes project role id as parameter. And, PROJECT_LEAD grant type do not.

The actual ARI formats are documented on the various concrete grant type values.
"""
enum JiraGrantTypeKeyEnum {
    """
    A role that user/group can play in a project.
    It takes project role as parameter.
    """
    PROJECT_ROLE

    """
    A application role is used to grant a user/group access to the application group.
    It takes application role as parameter.
    """
    APPLICATION_ROLE

    """
    An individual user who can be given the access to work on one or more projects.
    It takes user account id as parameter.
    """
    USER

    """
    A group is a collection of users who can be given access together.
    It represents group in the organization's user base.
    It takes group id as parameter.
    """
    GROUP

    """
    A multi user picker custom field.
    It takes multi user picker custom field id as parameter.
    """
    MULTI_USER_PICKER

    """
    A multi group picker custom field.
    It takes multi group picker custom field id as parameter.
    """
    MULTI_GROUP_PICKER

    """
    The grant type defines what the customers can do from the portal view.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    SERVICE_PROJECT_CUSTOMER_PORTAL_ACCESS

    """
    The issue reporter role.
    It takes platform defined 'reporter' as parameter to represent the issue field value.
    """
    REPORTER

    """
    The project lead role.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    PROJECT_LEAD

    """
    The issue assignee role.
    It takes platform defined 'assignee' as parameter to represent the issue field value.
    """
    ASSIGNEE

    """
    The anonymous access represents the public access without logging in.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    ANONYMOUS_ACCESS

    """
    Any user who has the product access.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    ANY_LOGGEDIN_USER_APPLICATION_ROLE
}

"""
The default grant type with only id and name to return data for grant types such as PROJECT_LEAD, APPLICATION_ROLE,

    APPLICATION_ROLE ari for JSM - ari:cloud:jira-servicedesk::role/123
    ANY_LOGGEDIN_USER_APPLICATION_ROLE ari - ari:cloud:jira::role/product/member
    ANONYMOUS_ACCESS ari - ari:cloud:identity::user/unidentified

jira_projects:
type Query {
    jira: JiraQuery
}

type JiraQuery {
    jiraProject(id: ID!): JiraProject

    """ A connection to projects """
    allJiraProjects(
        """
        The identifier that indicates that cloud instance this data is to be fetched for
        """
        cloudId : ID!,

        """The number of items to be sliced away to target between the after and before cursors"""
        first: Int,
        last: Int,

        """The index based cursor to specify the beginning of the items, if not specified it's assumed as the cursor for the item before the beginning"""
        after: String,
        before: String,

        """the filter criteria that is used to filter the projects"""
        filter: JiraProjectFilterInput!
    ): JiraProjectConnection

    """
    Loads a list of projects by specified ids - This may never be offered as public API depending on we map
    this in the gql gateway
    """
    jiraProjects(projectIds: [ID!]!): JiraProjectConnection

    allJiraIssueTypes(
        """
        The identifier that indicates that cloud instance this data is to be fetched for
        """
        cloudId : ID!,

        first: Int, after: String, last: Int, before: String): JiraIssueTypeConnection

    allJiraProjectCategories(
        """
        The identifier that indicates that cloud instance this data is to be fetched for
        """
        cloudId : ID!,

        first: Int, after: String, last: Int, before: String): JiraProjectCategoryConnection
}

input JiraProjectFilterInput {
    """the project types that can be used to filter list of projects"""
    types: [JiraProjectType!]

    """the project category that can be used to filter list of projects"""

    keyword: String

"""
Option parameters to fetch pricing plan for a marketplace entity
"""
input MarketplacePricingPlanOptions {
    """
    Period for which Pricing Plan is to be fetched. Defaults to MONTHLY
    """
    billingCycle: MarketplaceBillingCycle
    """
    Fetch pricing plan with status: LIVE, PENDING, DRAFT. Unless, pricing plan will be fetched based on user access
    """
    planStatus: MarketplacePricingPlanStatus
    """
    Currency code (ISO 4217) to return the amount in pricing items. Either of currencyCode and countryCode is needed. If currency code is not present, fallback to country code to fetch currency
    """
    currencyCode: String
    """
    Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) of the client. Either of currencyCode and countryCode is needed. If both are not present, fallback to default currency - USD
    """
    countryCode: String
}

"""
Pricing plan for a marketplace entity
"""
type MarketplacePricingPlan {
    """
    Billing cycle of the marketplace entity
    """
    billingCycle: MarketplaceBillingCycle!
    """
    Currency code for all items in the pricing plan. Defaults to USD
    """
    currency: String!
    """
    Status of the plan : LIVE, PENDING or DRAFT
    """
    status: MarketplacePricingPlanStatus!
    """
    Tiered Pricing for the plan
    """
    tieredPricing: MarketplaceTieredPricing!
}

"""
Tiered pricing object for pricing plan
"""
type MarketplaceTieredPricing {
    """
    Type of the tier
    """
    tierType: MarketplacePricingTierType!
    """
    Mode of the tier : GRADUATED (progressive PUP), VOLUME (constant for all users)
    """
    tiersMode: MarketplacePricingTierMode!
    """
    List of pricing items
    """
    items: [MarketplacePricingItem!]!
}

"""
Pricing items based on tiers
"""
type MarketplacePricingItem {
    """
    The lower limit for unit count (number of users of Jira, remote agents in Bamboo) defining this pricing tier
    """
    floor: Int!
    """
    The upper limit for unit count (number of users of Jira, remote agents in Bamboo) defining this pricing tier. Null in case of highest tier
    """
    ceiling: Int
    """
    The amount that a customer pays for a license at this tier
    """
    amount: Float!
    """
    Policy of the tier : BLOCK (FLAT) or PER_UNIT (PUP)
    """
    policy: MarketplacePricingTierPolicy!
}

"""
Mode of the tier : GRADUATED (progressive PUP), VOLUME (constant for all users). Defaults to GRADUATED
"""
enum  MarketplacePricingTierMode {
    GRADUATED, VOLUME
}

"""
Policy of the tier : BLOCK (FLAT) or PER_UNIT (PUP)
"""
enum MarketplacePricingTierPolicy {
    BLOCK, PER_UNIT
}

"""
Type of the tier
"""
enum MarketplacePricingTierType {
    USER_TIERED,
    REMOTE_AGENT_TIERED
}

"""
Billing cycle for which pricing plan applies
"""
enum MarketplaceBillingCycle {
    ANNUAL,
    MONTHLY
}

"""
Status of the plan : LIVE, PENDING or DRAFT
"""
enum MarketplacePricingPlanStatus {
    LIVE,
    PENDING,
    DRAFT
}

specific to this service.

type PolarisPresentation {
    """
    The type of presentation.  Intended to select the UI control for this
    field.
    """
    type: String!
    parameters: JSON
}

"""
An PolarisIdeaField is a unit of information that can be instantiated
for an PolarisIdea.
"""
interface PolarisIdeaField {
    """
    The fully qualified globally unique id (ARI) for this field
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    The key of this field in the `fields` structure if it is a Jira
    field.  Not set for things that don't appear in the fields section
    of a Jira issue object, such as "key"
    """
    jiraFieldKey: String

    """
    A short identifier suitable for at least within this project,
    but only supplied for fields that are returned via an PolarisIdea's fields
    attribute.  If not present, this field represents a builtin field
    on PolarisIdea.
    """
    fieldId: Int        @deprecated

    """
    The name of the field built in to PolarisIdea, if this field represents
    a builtin field.
    """
    fieldName: String        @deprecated

    label: String!

    """
    Are values in this field directly editable?  Some integrations
    might bring in data that is not directly editable.
    """
    editable: Boolean!

    """
    Can rows be sorted by this field?  Some fields are not commensurate
    and hence can't be sorted.
    """
    sortable: Boolean!

    """
    Is this field suitable for grouping operations like Board view?
    (i.e., may it appear in the groupBy field in a view?)
    """
    groupable: Boolean!

    """
    Is this field suitable for linear operations like plotting on an axis?
    (i.e., may it appear in the x or y field in a view?)
    """
    linearizable: Boolean!

    """
    What is the default sort order?  This is the order you get on
    "first click" of the column, and also the semantics of "ORDER BY"
    without an ASC or DESC qualifier.
    """
    defaultSortOrder: PolarisSortOrder

    """
    Values stored in this field can be decorated with visual elements
    (emojis, colors, backgrounds) for distinction. For discrete types
    such as Single/Multi select these will typically be exact matches
    on the static values allowed by the field. For orderable types
    such as strings, dates, numbers, etc decorations will more
    commonly be applied using ranges.
    """
    decorations: [PolarisDecoration!]

    """
    Refines how we should present the field.  For example, a number
    field might be presented with a Rating picker.
    """
    presentation: PolarisPresentation

    """
    The formula for calculated fields; null for regular (stored) fields
    """
    formula: JSON

    """
    Description
    """
    description: String

    """
    Field emoji
    """
    emoji: String

    """
    An identifier for fields built in to Jira or Polaris.  For example, "Key" and
    "Delivery progress" are builtin fields.
    """
    builtin: BuiltinPolarisIdeaField
}

## Types

type PolarisInsight {
    """
    ARI of the insight, for example:

       `ari:cloud:cebeacbd-f85e-483c-96ac-fd432a12ad1c:polaris-insight/10004`
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    The ID of the object within the project which contains this data
    point (nee insight), if any.  In the usual case, if not null, this
    is an idea (issue) ARI
    """
    container: ID

    """
    AAID of the user who owns the insight
    """
    aaid: String!

    """
    Description in ADF format.  See
    https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/atlassian-document-format/
    """
    description: JSON

    """
    Array of snippets attached to this data point.
    """
    snippets: [PolarisSnippet!]!

    """
    Creation time of data point in RFC3339 format
    """
    created: String!

    """
    Updated time of data point in RFC3339 format
    """
    updated: String!


}

input CreatePolarisInsightInput {
    """
    The cloudID in which we are adding insight
    """
    cloudID: String!
    """
    The projectID in which we are adding insight
    """
    projectID: Int!
    """
    The issueID in which we are adding insight, cloud be empty for adding insight on project level
    """
    issueID: Int

    """
    DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE
    Array of datas in JSON format. It will be validated with JSON schema of Polaris Insights Data format.
    """
    data: [JSON!]

    """
    Array of snippets
    """
    snippets: [CreatePolarisSnippetInput!]
    """
    Description in ADF format https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/atlassian-document-format/
    """
    description: JSON
}

input CopyPolarisInsightsContainerInput {
    """
    The project ARI which contains container
    """
    project: ID!
    """
    The container ARI which contains insights
    """
    container: ID
}

input CopyPolarisInsightsInput {
    """
    Source container to copy insgihts
    """
    source: CopyPolarisInsightsContainerInput!
    """
    Destination container to copy insgihts
    """
    destination: CopyPolarisInsightsContainerInput!
    """
    Insight ARI's list that should be copied. Leave it empty to copy all insights from source to destination
    """
    insights: [String!]
}

input UpdatePolarisInsightInput {
    description: JSON
    snippets: [UpdatePolarisSnippetInput!]
}

## Mutations

extend type Mutation {
    """
    Creates a new play.  A play will manifest as a field, and play
    contributions will manifest as insights (data points) with
    snippets associated with the play.

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    createPolarisPlay(input: CreatePolarisPlayInput!): CreatePolarisPlayPayload

    """

    Creates or updates a contribution to a play.  The contribution
    will manifest as an insight.  Returns an error if the contribution
    is not acceptable to the parameters of the play, such as spending
    more than the max amount in a BudgetAllocation ("$10 Game") play

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    createPolarisPlayContribution(input: CreatePolarisPlayContribution!): CreatePolarisPlayContributionPayload

    """
    Updates an existing contribution to a play.

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    updatePolarisPlayContribution(id: ID!, input: UpdatePolarisPlayContribution!): UpdatePolarisPlayContributionPayload

    """
    Deletes an existing contribution to a play.

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    deletePolarisPlayContribution(id: ID!): DeletePolarisPlayContributionPayload

    """
    Creates a new data point from a play contribution

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    createPolarisInsightFromPlayContribution(input: CreatePolarisInsightFromPlayContributionInput): CreatePolarisInsightPayload
}

## Types

extend type PolarisProject {
    plays: [PolarisPlay!]
    play(id: ID!): PolarisPlay
}

extend type PolarisInsight {
    play: PolarisPlay           # if an insight is from a play, a link to the play
    contribs: [PolarisPlayContribution!]        # if an insight is from a play, the associated contributions
}

input CreatePolarisPlayContribution {
    play: ID!       # the play being contributed to
    subject: ID!    # the issue (idea) to which this contribution is being made
    amount: Int     # the extent of the contribution (null=drop value)
    comment: JSON   # the comment (null=drop value)
}

input UpdatePolarisPlayContribution {
    amount: Int     # the extent of the contribution (null=drop value)
    comment: ID     # the comment (null=drop value, which is not permitted; delete the contribution if needed)
    content: JSON   # optional comment content to update
}

type CreatePolarisPlayContributionPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
    node: PolarisPlayContribution
}

type UpdatePolarisPlayContributionPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
    node: PolarisPlayContribution
}

type DeletePolarisPlayContributionPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
}

extend enum PolarisFieldType {
    PolarisIdeaPlayField
}

type PolarisIdeaPlayField implements PolarisIdeaField {
    id: ID!
    fieldId: Int
    fieldName: String
    label: String!
    editable: Boolean!
    sortable: Boolean!
    groupable: Boolean!
    linearizable: Boolean!
    defaultSortOrder: PolarisSortOrder
    jiraFieldKey: String
    decorations: [PolarisDecoration!]
    formula: JSON                       # no formula support for now
    presentation: PolarisPresentation   # probably nothing here for now
    description: String
    emoji: String

}

input CreatePolarisPlayInput {
    project: ID!
    kind: PolarisPlayKind!
    label: String!                      # the label for the play field, and the "short" name of the play
    summary: String
    parameters: JSON
    fromView: ID                        # the view from which the play is created
    description: JSON
}

enum PolarisPlayKind {
     PolarisBudgetAllocationPlay        # each participant gets a budget to spend on ideas
}

type CreatePolarisPlayPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
    node: PolarisPlay
}

type PolarisPlay {
    id: ID!
    label: String!                      # the label for the play
    kind: PolarisPlayKind!              # the kind of play this is
    view: PolarisView                   # if there is a specific view for this play
    fields: [PolarisIdeaPlayField!]     # if there are fields for this play
    parameters: JSON                    # the parameters used to define the play
    contributions: [PolarisPlayContribution!]
    contribution(id: ID!): PolarisPlayContribution
}

extend type PolarisConnectApp {
    play: PolarisPlay                   # the play for this "connect app" (i.e., oauth client id) if it is one
}

type PolarisPlayContribution {
    id: ID!
    play: PolarisPlay!                  # the play that contains the contribution
    subject: ID!                        # the item to which the contribution applies (the idea)
    aaid: String!                       # the author of the contribution
    comment: PolarisComment
    amount: Int
    created: String!                    # when this contribution was created
    updated: String!                    # when this contribution was last updated
    appearsIn: PolarisInsight           # the insight that this contribution appears in
}

input CreatePolarisInsightFromPlayContributionInput {
    """
    The ARI of the play contribution
    """
    contribution: ID!

    """
    The ARI of the idea to add the insight to.  If null, then the insight
    is added to the idea that the contribution is for.
    """
    subject: ID
}

type PolarisRefreshJob {
     progress: PolarisRefreshJobProgress

     """
     If this is a synchronous refresh, we can return the newly refreshed snippets
     directly.
     """
     refreshedSnippets: [PolarisSnippet!]
}

type PolarisRefreshJobProgress {
     pendingCount: Int!
     errorCount: Int!
}

type PolarisRefreshInfo {
    error: String                       # an error message
    errorCode: Int                      # an error code
    errorType: PolarisRefreshError      # enum version of errorCode
    queued: String                      # (timestamp) when it was queued
    last: String                        # (timestamp) when was last refreshed
    next: String                        # (timestamp) when will next be refreshed
    autoSeconds: Int                    # auto refresh interval in seconds
    timeToLiveSeconds: Int              # semi-auto interval (time to live) in seconds
}

enum PolarisRefreshError {
    NEED_AUTH
    INVALID_SNIPPET
    NOT_FOUND
    INTERNAL_ERROR
}



type ProjectAvatars {
    x16: URL!
    x24: URL!
    x32: URL!
    x48: URL!
}

type PolarisProject {
    """
    ARI of the project which is a polaris project, for example:

       `ari:cloud:cebeacbd-f85e-483c-96ac-fd432a12ad1c:project/10004`
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    Jira activation ID
    """
    activationId: String

    """
    Every Jira project has a name
    """
    name: String!

    """
    Every Jira project has a key
    """
    key: String!

    """
    Project avatar URL
    """
    avatarUrls: ProjectAvatars!

    """
    The view sets associated with this project
    """
    viewsets: [PolarisViewSet!]

    views: [PolarisView!]!

    rankField: ID

    fields: [PolarisIdeaField!]!

    """
    Initially only expect to have one idea type per project.  Defining
    as a list here for future expandability.
    """
    ideaTypes: [PolarisIdeaType!]!

    insights: [PolarisInsight!]

    """
    OAuth clients (and potentially other data providers) that have access
    to this project.
    """
    snippetProviders: [PolarisSnippetProvider!]

    refreshing: PolarisRefreshStatus!

    onboarded: Boolean!

    template: PolarisProjectTemplate

    selectedDeliveryProject: ID

    ideas: [PolarisIdea!]!

    issueLinkType: PolarisIssueLinkType!

    statusCategories: [PolarisStatusCategory!]

    arjConfiguration:  ArjConfiguration!
