xen_invocation_service:
directive @rateLimit(
  max: Int
  window: String
  message: String
  identityArgs: [String]
  arrayLengthField: String
) on FIELD_DEFINITION

"""
Payload to invoke an AUX Effect
"""
input AuxEffectsInvocationPayload {
  """The current state of the AUX extension"""
  state: JSON!

  """The effects to action inside the function"""
  effects: [JSON!]!

  """Environment information about where the effects were dispatched from"""
  context: JSON!

  """A signed token representing the context information of the extension"""
  contextToken: String

  """Configuration arguments for the instance of the AUX extension"""
  config: JSON
}

"""A response to an aux invocation"""
type AuxEffectsResult {
  """
  The list of effects in response to an aux effects invocation.

  Render effects should return valid rendering effects to the invoker,
  to allow the front-end to render the required content. These are kept as
  generic JSON blobs since consumers of this API are responsible for defining
  what these effects look like.
  """
  effects: [JSON!]!
}

"""A response to a tunnel creation request"""
type CreateAppTunnelResponse implements Payload {
  success: Boolean!
  errors: [MutationError!]

  """
  The recommended keep-alive time (in milliseconds) by which the forge CLI (or
  other clients) should re-establish the forge tunnel.
  This is guaranteed to be less than the expiry of the forge tunnel.
  """
  keepAlive: String

  """
  The actual expiry time (in milliseconds) of the created forge tunnel. Once the
  tunnel expires, Forge apps will display the deployed version even
  if the local development server is still active.
  """
  expiry: String
}

"""
Establish tunnels for a specific environment of an app.

This will redirect all function calls to the provided faas url. This URL must implement the same
invocation contract that is used elsewhere in Xen.

This will also be used to redirect Custom UI product rendering to the custom ui urls. We separate
them by extension key.
"""
input CreateAppTunnelsInput {
  """The app to setup a tunnel for"""
  appId: ID!

  """The environment key"""
  environmentKey: String!
  tunnelDefinitions: TunnelDefinitionsInput!

  """Should existing tunnels be overwritten"""
  force: Boolean
}

input TunnelDefinitionsInput {
  """
  The URL to tunnel FaaS calls to
  """
  faasTunnelUrl: URL

  customUI: [CustomUITunnelDefinitionInput]
}

input CustomUITunnelDefinitionInput {
  resourceKey: String
  tunnelUrl: URL
}

input DeleteAppTunnelInput {
  """The app to setup a tunnel for"""
  appId: ID!

  """The environment key"""
  environmentKey: String!
}

type ErrorDetails {
  """
  Specific code used to make difference between errors to handle them differently
  """
  code: String!

  """Addition error data"""
  fields: JSON

  """Copy of top-level message"""
  message: String!
}

"""An arbitrary extension definition as defined by the Ecosystem"""
type Extension {
  id: ID!
  definitionId: ID!
  environmentId: ID!
  environmentKey: String!
  environmentType: String!
  installationId: String!
  type: String!
  key: String!
  appOwner: String!
  appVersion: String
  properties: JSON!
}

"""The context in which an extension exists"""
type ExtensionContext {
  id: ID!
  extensionsByType(type: String!): [Extension!]!
}

"""
Details about an extension.

This information is used to look up the extension within CaaS so that the
correct function can be resolved.

This will eventually be superseded by an Id.
"""
input ExtensionDetailsInput {
  """The definition identifier as provided by CaaS"""
  definitionId: ID!

  """ The extension key as provided by CaaS """
  extensionKey: String!
}

type ExternalAuthProvider {
  key: String!
  displayName: String!
  url: URL!
}

type GenericMutationErrorExtension implements MutationErrorExtension {
  statusCode: Int
  errorType: String
}

"""
Generic implementation of MutationResponse for responses that don't need any extra data
"""
type GenericMutationResponse implements Payload {
  success: Boolean!
  errors: [MutationError!]
}

"""The data returned from a function invocation"""
type InvocationResponsePayload {
  """The body of the function response"""
  body: JSON!
}

"""Input payload for the invoke aux mutation"""
input InvokeAuxEffectsInput {
  """
  The list of applicable context Ids
  Context Ids are used within the ecosystem platform to identify product
  controlled areas into which apps can be installed. Host products should
  determine how this list of contexts is constructed.

  *Important:* this should start with the most specific context as the
  most specific extension will be the selected extension.
  """
  contextIds: [ID!]!

  """
  Information needed to look up an extension

  Note: Either `extensionDetails` or `extensionId` must be provided
  """
  extensionDetails: ExtensionDetailsInput

  """
  An identifier for the extension to invoke

  Note: Either `extensionDetails` or `extensionId` must be provided
  """
  extensionId: ID

  """
  An identifier for an alternative entry point function to invoke
  """
  entryPoint: String

  """The payload to invoke an AUX Effect"""
  payload: AuxEffectsInvocationPayload!
}

"""The response from an AUX effects invocation"""
type InvokeAuxEffectsResponse implements MutationResponse & Payload {
  statusCode: Int! @deprecated
  message: String! @deprecated
  errorDetails: ErrorDetails @deprecated
  success: Boolean!
  errors: [MutationError!]
  result: AuxEffectsResult
}

"""Input payload for the invoke mutation"""
input InvokeExtensionInput {
  """
  The list of applicable context Ids
  Context Ids are used within the ecosystem platform to identify product
  controlled areas into which apps can be installed. Host products should
  determine how this list of contexts is constructed.

  *Important:* this should start with the most specific context as the
  most specific extension will be the selected extension.
  """
  contextIds: [ID!]!

  """
  Information needed to look up an extension

  Note: Either `extensionDetails` or `extensionId` must be provided
  """
  extensionDetails: ExtensionDetailsInput

  """
  An identifier for the extension to invoke

  Note: Either `extensionDetails` or `extensionId` must be provided
  """
  extensionId: ID

  """The payload to send as part of the invocation"""
  payload: JSON!

  """An identifier for an alternative entry point function to invoke"""
  entryPoint: String

  """An identifier for a schema to validate the response against"""
  schema: String
}

type InvokeExtensionPayloadErrorExtension implements MutationErrorExtension {
  errorType: String
  statusCode: Int
  fields: InvokeExtensionPayloadErrorExtensionFields
}

type InvokeExtensionPayloadErrorExtensionFields {
  authInfoUrl: String
}

"""The response from a function invocation"""
type InvokeExtensionResponse implements MutationResponse & Payload {
  statusCode: Int! @deprecated
  message: String! @deprecated
  errorDetails: ErrorDetails @deprecated
  success: Boolean!
  errors: [MutationError!]

  """The invocation response"""
  response: InvocationResponsePayload

  """
  Details about the external auth for this service, if any exists.

  This is typically used for directing the user to a consent screen.
  """
  externalAuth: [ExternalAuthProvider]
}

"""
The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).
"""
scalar JSON

type Mutation {
  """
  Create multiple tunnels for an app

  This will allow api calls for this app to be tunnelled to a locally running
  server to help with writing and debugging functions.

  This call covers both the FaaS tunnel as well as registering multiple Custom UI tunnels
  that can then be used in the products instead of serving the usual CDN url.

  This call will fail if a tunnel already exists, unless the 'force' flag is set.

  Tunnels automatically expire after 30 minutes
  """
  createAppTunnels(input: CreateAppTunnelsInput!): CreateAppTunnelResponse

  """
  Delete tunnels for an app

  All FaaS traffic for this app will return to invoking the deployed function
  instead of the tunnel url.

  Same will be done for the Custom UI tunnels, where the normal CDN url will be
  used instead of the tunnel url.
  """
  deleteAppTunnels(input: DeleteAppTunnelInput!): GenericMutationResponse

  """
  Invoke a function associated with a specific extension.

  This is intended to be the main way to interact with extension functions
  created for apps
  """

"The configuration for a scorecard criterion representing the presence of an owner."
type CompassHasOwnerScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
    "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!

    "Returns the calculated score for a component."
    scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore
}

"The configuration for a scorecard criterion checking the value of a specified metric name."
type CompassHasMetricValueScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
    "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!

    "The threshold value that the metric is compared to."
    comparatorValue: Float!

    "The ID of the component metric to check the value of."
    metricDefinitionId: ID!

    "The comparison operation to be performed between the metric and comparator value."
    comparator: CompassCriteriaNumberComparatorOptions!

    "Returns the calculated score for a component."
    scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore

    "Returns the metric definition this criteria uses."
    metricDefinition: CompassMetricDefinition
}

"Accepts input to create a scorecard criterion."
input CreateCompassScorecardCriteriasInput {
    criterias: [CreateCompassScorecardCriteriaInput!]!
}

"Accepts input to create a scorecard criterion."
input CreateCompassScorecardCriteriaInput {
    hasLink: CreateCompassHasLinkScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasField: CreateCompassHasFieldScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasDescription: CreateCompassHasDescriptionScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasOwner: CreateCompassHasOwnerScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasMetricValue: CreateCompassHasMetricValueCriteriaInput
}

"Accepts input to create a scorecard criterion checking the value of a specified metric ID."
input CreateCompassHasMetricValueCriteriaInput {
    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!

    "The ID of the component metric to check the value of."
    metricDefinitionId: ID!

    "The threshold value that the metric is compared to."
    comparatorValue: Float!

    "The comparison operation to be performed between the metric and comparator value."
    comparator: CompassCriteriaNumberComparatorOptions!
}

enum CompassCriteriaNumberComparatorOptions {
    EQUALS,
    GREATER_THAN,
    LESS_THAN,
    GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
    LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
}

"Accepts input to create a scorecard criterion representing the presence of a link, for example, 'Has Repository' or 'Has Documentation'."
input CreateCompassHasLinkScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!

    "The type of link, for example, 'Repository' if 'Has Repository'."
    linkType: CompassLinkType!
}

"Accepts input to create a scorecard criterion representing the presence of a field, for example, 'Has Tier'."
input CreateCompassHasFieldScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!

    "The ID for the field definition that is the target of a relationship."
    fieldDefinitionId: ID!
}

"Accepts input to a create a scorecard criterion representing the presence of a description."
input CreateCompassHasDescriptionScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!
}

"Accepts input to a create a scorecard criterion representing the presence of an owner."
input CreateCompassHasOwnerScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int!
}

input UpdateCompassScorecardCriteriasInput {
    criterias: [UpdateCompassScorecardCriteriaInput!]!
}

input UpdateCompassScorecardCriteriaInput {
    hasLink: UpdateCompassHasLinkScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasField: UpdateCompassHasFieldScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasDescription: UpdateCompassHasDescriptionScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasOwner: UpdateCompassHasOwnerScorecardCriteriaInput
    hasMetricValue: UpdateCompassHasMetricValueCriteriaInput
}

input UpdateCompassHasMetricValueCriteriaInput {
    "ID of the scorecard criteria to update"
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int

    "The ID of the component metric to check the value of."
    metricDefinitionId: ID

    "The threshold value that the metric is compared to."
    comparatorValue: Float

    "The comparison operation to be performed between the metric and comparator value."
    comparator: CompassCriteriaNumberComparatorOptions
}

input UpdateCompassHasLinkScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "ID of the scorecard criteria to update"
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int

    "The type of link, for example, 'Repository' if 'Has Repository'."
    linkType: CompassLinkType
}

input UpdateCompassHasFieldScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "ID of the scorecard criteria to update"
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int

    "The ID for the field definition which is the target of a relationship."
    fieldDefinitionId: ID
}

input UpdateCompassHasDescriptionScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "The ID of the scorecard criterion to update."
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int
}

input UpdateCompassHasOwnerScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "The ID of the scorecard criterion to update."
    id: ID!

    "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
    weight: Int
}

input DeleteCompassScorecardCriteriasInput {
    criterias: [DeleteCompassScorecardCriteriaInput!]!
}

input DeleteCompassScorecardCriteriaInput {
    "ID of the scorecard criterion for deletion. The criteria is already applied to a scorecard."
    id: ID!
}

"The payload returned from creating a scorecard criterion."
type CreateCompassScorecardCriteriasPayload implements Payload {
    "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]

    "The scorecard that was mutated."
    scorecard: CompassScorecard
}

"The payload returned from updating a scorecard criterion."
type UpdateCompassScorecardCriteriasPayload implements Payload {
    "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]

    "The scorecard that was mutated."

}

"The payload returned from deleting a scorecard criterion."
type DeleteCompassScorecardCriteriasPayload implements Payload {
    "Whether the mutation was successful or not"

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]

"A relationship between two components."
type CompassRelationship {
    "The type of relationship."
    type: CompassRelationshipType!

    "The starting node of the relationship."
    startNode: CompassComponent

    "The ending node of the relationship."
    endNode: CompassComponent

    changeMetadata: CompassChangeMetadata
}

"Defines the relationship types. A relationship must be one of these types."
enum CompassRelationshipType {
    DEPENDS_ON
}

"Defines the possible relationship directions between components."
enum CompassRelationshipDirection {
    "Going from the other component to this component."
    INWARD

    "Going from this component to the other component."
    OUTWARD
}

"Accepts input for finding component relationships."
input CompassRelationshipQuery {
    "The number of relationships to return in the query."
    first: Int

    "The relationships to be returned after the specified cursor position."
    after: String

    "The direction of relationships to be searched for."
    direction: CompassRelationshipDirection! = OUTWARD

    "The filters for the relationships to be searched for."
    filters: CompassRelationshipQueryFilters
}

input CompassRelationshipQueryFilters {
    "OR'd set of relationship types."
    types: [CompassRelationshipType!]
}

union CompassRelationshipConnectionResult = CompassRelationshipConnection | QueryError

type CompassRelationshipConnection {
    edges: [CompassRelationshipEdge!]
    nodes: [CompassRelationship!]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

type CompassRelationshipEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: CompassRelationship
}

"Accepts input for creating a new relationship."
input CreateCompassRelationshipInput {
    "The type of the relationship."
    type: CompassRelationshipType!

    "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the starting node."
    startNodeId: ID!

    "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the ending node."
    endNodeId: ID!
}

"The payload returned from creating a new relationship."
type CreateCompassRelationshipPayload implements Payload {
    "The newly created relationship between two components."
    createdCompassRelationship: CompassRelationship

    "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]
}

"Accepts input for deleting an existing relationship between two components."
input DeleteCompassRelationshipInput {
    "The type of the relationship."
    type: CompassRelationshipType!

    "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the starting node."
    startNodeId: ID!

    "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the ending node."
    endNodeId: ID!
}

"The payload returned from deleting an existing component."
type DeleteCompassRelationshipPayload implements Payload {
    "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]
}

##########################
# Mutation Responses
##########################

"""
The general shape of a mutation response.
"""
interface Payload {
    "Whether the mutation is successful."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors if the mutation is not successful."
    errors: [MutationError!]
}

type MutationError {
    message: String
    extensions : MutationErrorExtension
}

interface MutationErrorExtension {
    """A numerical code (such as an HTTP status code) representing the error category."""
    statusCode: Int

    """A code representing the type of error. See the CompassErrorType enum for possible values."""
    errorType: String
}

type GenericMutationErrorExtension implements MutationErrorExtension {
    statusCode: Int
    """A code representing the type of error. See the CompassErrorType enum for possible values"""
    errorType: String
}

"A label provides additional contextual information about a component."
type CompassComponentLabel {
    "The name of the label."
    name: String
}

"Accepts input for adding labels to a component."
input AddCompassComponentLabelsInput {
    "The ID of the component to add the labels to."
    componentId: ID!

    "The collection of labels to add to the component."
    labelNames: [String!]!
}

"Accepts input for removing labels from a component."
input RemoveCompassComponentLabelsInput {
    "The ID of the component to remove the labels from."
    componentId: ID!

    "The collection of labels to remove from the component."
    labelNames: [String!]!
}

"The payload returned after adding labels to a component."
type AddCompassComponentLabelsPayload implements Payload {
    "The collection of labels that were added to the component."
    addedLabels: [CompassComponentLabel!]

    "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]

    "The details of the component that was mutated."
    componentDetails: CompassComponent
}

"The payload returned after removing labels from a component."
type RemoveCompassComponentLabelsPayload implements Payload {
    "The collection of labels that were removed from the component."
    removedLabelNames: [String!]

    "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
    success: Boolean!

    "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
    errors: [MutationError!]

    "The details of the component that was mutated."
    componentDetails: CompassComponent
}

    "The description of the metric definition."

    """if null then no format type is applicable to the definition, values are plain numbers"""
    format: CompassMetricDefinitionFormat

    "The type of the metric definition based on where the definition originated"
    type: CompassMetricDefinitionType!

    "A collection of metrics which contain values that provide numerical data."

}

type Query

type Mutation

schema {
    query: Query,
    mutation: Mutation
}

"Indicates that the user should specify one and only one field from the input object."
directive @oneOf on INPUT_OBJECT

"""
The top level wrapper for the Compass Query API.
"""
type CompassCatalogQueryApi {
    "Retrieves a single component by its internal ID."
    component(id: ID!): CompassComponentResult

    "Retrieves a single component by its external alias."
    componentByExternalAlias(cloudId: ID!, externalSource: ID, externalID: ID!): CompassComponentResult

    "Retrieves field definitions by component type."
    fieldDefinitionsByComponentType(cloudId: ID!, input: CompassComponentType!): CompassFieldDefinitionsResult

    "Searches for Compass components."
    searchComponents(cloudId: String!, query: CompassSearchComponentQuery): CompassComponentQueryResult

    "Searches for Compass component labels."
    searchComponentLabels(cloudId: String!, query: CompassSearchComponentLabelsQuery): CompassComponentLabelsQueryResult

    "Retrieve all starred components based on the user id."
    starredComponents(cloudId: ID!, query: CompassStarredComponentQuery): CompassStarredComponentQueryResult

    "A collection of checkins posted by a team; sorted by most recent."
    teamCheckins(input: CompassTeamCheckinsInput!): [CompassTeamCheckin!]

    "A collection of metric definitions on a Compass site. A metric definition provides details for a metric source."
    metricDefinitions(query: CompassMetricDefinitionsQuery!): CompassMetricDefinitionsQueryResult

    "Retrieves the list of built in metric definitions provided by Compass."
    builtinMetricDefinitions: [CompassMetricDefinition!]!
}

union CompassComponentResult = CompassComponent | QueryError
union CompassFieldDefinitionsResult = CompassFieldDefinitions | QueryError
union CompassComponentQueryResult = CompassSearchComponentConnection | QueryError
union CompassComponentLabelsQueryResult = CompassSearchComponentLabelsConnection | QueryError
union CompassStarredComponentQueryResult = CompassStarredComponentConnection | QueryError

"""
The top level wrapper for the Compass Mutations API.
"""
type CompassCatalogMutationApi {
    "Creates a new component."
    createComponent(cloudId: ID!, input: CreateCompassComponentInput!): CreateCompassComponentPayload

    "Updates an existing component."
    updateComponent(input: UpdateCompassComponentInput!): UpdateCompassComponentPayload

    "Deletes an existing component."
    deleteComponent(input: DeleteCompassComponentInput!): DeleteCompassComponentPayload

    "Creates a link for a component."
    createComponentLink(input: CreateCompassComponentLinkInput!): CreateCompassComponentLinkPayload

    "Updates a link from a component."
    updateComponentLink(input: UpdateCompassComponentLinkInput!): UpdateCompassComponentLinkPayload

    "Deletes an existing link from a component."
    deleteComponentLink(input: DeleteCompassComponentLinkInput!): DeleteCompassComponentLinkPayload

    "Creates an external alias for a component."
    createComponentExternalAlias(input: CreateCompassComponentExternalAliasInput!): CreateCompassComponentExternalAliasPayload

    "Deletes an existing external alias from a component."
    deleteComponentExternalAlias(input: DeleteCompassComponentExternalAliasInput!): DeleteCompassComponentExternalAliasPayload

    "Creates a new relationship between two components."
    createRelationship(input: CreateCompassRelationshipInput!): CreateCompassRelationshipPayload

    "Deletes an existing relationship between two components."
    deleteRelationship(input: DeleteCompassRelationshipInput!): DeleteCompassRelationshipPayload

    "Adds a collection of labels to a component."
    addComponentLabels(input: AddCompassComponentLabelsInput!): AddCompassComponentLabelsPayload

    "Removes a collection of existing labels from a component."
    removeComponentLabels(input: RemoveCompassComponentLabelsInput!): RemoveCompassComponentLabelsPayload

    "Creates an announcement for a component."
    createAnnouncement(input: CompassCreateAnnouncementInput!): CompassCreateAnnouncementPayload

    "Updates an announcement from a component."
    updateAnnouncement(input: CompassUpdateAnnouncementInput!): CompassUpdateAnnouncementPayload

    "Deletes an existing announcement from a component."
    deleteAnnouncement(input: CompassDeleteAnnouncementInput!): CompassDeleteAnnouncementPayload

    "Acknowledges an announcement on behalf of a component."
    acknowledgeAnnouncement(input: CompassAcknowledgeAnnouncementInput!): CompassAcknowledgeAnnouncementPayload

    "Creates an event source."
    createEventSource(input: CreateEventSourceInput!) : CreateEventSourcePayload

    "Deletes an event source."
    deleteEventSource(input: DeleteEventSourceInput!) : DeleteEventSourcePayload

    "Creates a deployment event."
    createDeploymentEvent(input: CreateDeploymentEventInput!) : CreateDeploymentEventsPayload

    "Creates a compass event."
    createCompassEvent(input: CompassEventInput!) : CompassCreateEventsPayload

    "Attaches an event source to a component."
    attachEventSource(input: AttachEventSourceInput!) : AttachEventSourcePayload

    "Detaches an event source from a component."
    detachEventSource(input: DetachEventSourceInput!) : DetachEventSourcePayload

    "Creates a starred relationship between a user and a component."
    createStarredComponent(cloudId: ID!, input: CreateCompassStarredComponentInput!) : CreateCompassStarredComponentPayload

    "Deletes a starred relationship between a user and a component."
    deleteStarredComponent(cloudId: ID!, input: DeleteCompassStarredComponentInput!) : DeleteCompassStarredComponentPayload

    "Creates a checkin for a team."
    createTeamCheckin(input: CompassCreateTeamCheckinInput!): CompassCreateTeamCheckinPayload

    "Updates a checkin for a team."
    updateTeamCheckin(input: CompassUpdateTeamCheckinInput!): CompassUpdateTeamCheckinPayload

    "Deletes a checkin from a team."
    deleteTeamCheckin(input: CompassDeleteTeamCheckinInput!): CompassDeleteTeamCheckinPayload

    "Creates a metric definition on a Compass site. A metric definition provides details for a metric source."
    createMetricDefinition(input: CompassCreateMetricDefinitionInput!): CompassCreateMetricDefinitionPayload

    "Updates a metric definition on a Compass site."
    updateMetricDefinition(input: CompassUpdateMetricDefinitionInput!): CompassUpdateMetricDefinitionPayload

    "Deletes a metric definition including the metric sources it defines from a Compass site. Metric sources contain values providing numerical data about a component."
    deleteMetricDefinition(input: CompassDeleteMetricDefinitionInput!): CompassDeleteMetricDefinitionPayload

    "Creates a metric source for a component. A metric source contains values providing numerical data about a component."
    createMetricSource(input: CompassCreateMetricSourceInput!): CompassCreateMetricSourcePayload

    "Deletes a metric source including the metric values it contains."
    deleteMetricSource(input: CompassDeleteMetricSourceInput!): CompassDeleteMetricSourcePayload

    "Inserts a metric value in a metric source for a component."
    insertMetricValue(input: CompassInsertMetricValueInput!): CompassInsertMetricValuePayload
}

extend type Query {
    compass: CompassCatalogQueryApi
}

extend type Mutation {
    compass: CompassCatalogMutationApi
}

"AGG Types"
scalar JSON
scalar URL
scalar DateTime
scalar Long

"Standard Relay node interface"
interface Node {
    # The id of the node
    id: ID!
}


type CompassAlertEvent implements CompassEvent {
    "The type of the event."
    eventType: CompassEventType!

    "The name of the event."
    displayName: String!

    "The last time this event was updated."
    lastUpdated: DateTime!

    "The sequence number specifying the order of updates of the event."
    updateSequenceNumber: Long!

    "Alert Id"
    alertId: ID!

    "The description of the event."
    description: String

    "The URL of the event."
    url: URL
}

input CompassCreateAlertEventInput {
    "The cloud ID of the site to create an alert event for."
    cloudId: ID!

    "The type of the event."
    eventType: CompassEventType!

    "The name of the event."
    displayName: String!

    "The last time this event was updated."
    lastUpdated: DateTime!

    "Alert Id"
    alertId: ID!

    "The sequence number specifying the order of updates of the alert event."
    updateSequenceNumber: Long!

    "The description of the event."
    description: String

    "The URL of the event."
    url: URL

    "The ID of the external event source."
    externalEventSourceId: ID!
}

"The configuration for a scorecard that can be used by components."
type CompassScorecard implements Node {
    "The unique identifier (ID) of the scorecard."
    id: ID!

    "The name of the scorecard."
    name: String!

    "The description of the scorecard."
    description: String

    "The criteria used for calculating the score."
    criterias: [CompassScorecardCriteria!]

    "The unique identifier (ID) of the scorecard's owner."
    ownerId: ID

    "The type of component to which this scorecard is restricted."
    componentType: CompassComponentType!

    "Determines how the scorecard will be applied by default."
    importance: CompassScorecardImportance!

    "Returns the calculated total score for a given component."
    scorecardScore(query: CompassScorecardScoreQuery): CompassScorecardScore

    "Returns a list of components to which this scorecard is applied."
    appliedToComponents(query: CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQuery): CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQueryResult

    "Contains change metadata for the scorecard."
    changeMetadata: CompassChangeMetadata!
}

extend type CompassComponent {
    "A collection of scorecards applied to a component."
    scorecards: [CompassScorecard!]

    "A collection of scorecard scores applied to a component."
    scorecardScores: [CompassScorecardScore!]

    "A collection of scorecards applicable to a component."
    applicableScorecards: [CompassScorecard!]

    "Returns the calculated total score for a given scorecard applied to this component."
    scorecardScore(query: CompassComponentScorecardScoreQuery): CompassScorecardScore
}

"The types used to identify the importance of the scorecard."
enum CompassScorecardImportance {
    "Automatically applied to all components of the specified type or types and cannot be removed."
    REQUIRED

    "Recommended to the component's owner when they select a scorecard to apply to their component."
    RECOMMENDED

    "Custom scorecard, focused on specific use cases within teams or departments."
    USER_DEFINED
}

# QUERY TYPES

"Accepts input to find available scorecards."
input CompassScorecardsQuery {
    "The first N number of scorecards to return in the query."
    first: Int

    "Returns the scorecards after the specified cursor position."
    after: String
}

union CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQueryResult = CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsConnection | QueryError

type CompassScorecardConnection {
    edges: [CompassScorecardEdge!]
    nodes: [CompassScorecard!]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

type CompassScorecardEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: CompassScorecard
}

input CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQueryFilter {
    score: CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsThresholdFilter!
}

input CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsThresholdFilter {
    lt: Int!
}

"Accepts input to find components a scorecard is applied to and their scores"
input CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQuery {
    "The first N number of components to return in the query."
    first: Int

    "Returns the components after the specified cursor position."
    after: String

    "Returns only components whose attributes match those in the filters specified"
    filter: CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQueryFilter
}

type CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsConnection {
    edges: [CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsEdge!]
    nodes: [CompassComponent!]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

type CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: CompassComponent
}

# MUTATION INPUTS/PAYLOAD TYPES

input CreateCompassScorecardInput {
    name: String!
    description: String
    ownerId: ID

"A component represents a software development artifact tracked in Compass."

cs_extensions:
"""
The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).
"""
scalar JSON @specifiedBy(url: "http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf")

"""URL"""
scalar URL

scalar DateTime

"""
A concrete error type that can be returned in response to a failed mutation

This extension carries additional categorization information about the error
"""
interface MutationErrorExtension {
  """Application specific error trace"""
  errorType: String

  """
  A numerical code (as a HTTP status code) representing the error category
  """
  statusCode: Int

  """Additional error details"""
  fields: JSON
}

"""An error that has occurred in response to a mutation"""
type MutationError {
  """A human readable error message"""
  message: String

  """A list of extensions to the error"""
  extensions: MutationErrorExtension
}

"""
The second version of the Atlassian mutation response format, this format supersedes MutationResponse. Any type
implementing this interface should follow the naming convention XYZPayload where XYZ is some chosen type name for
the mutation.

This mutation format is intentionally similar to the error format also used for other resolver errors.
"""
interface Payload {
  """Was this mutation successful"""
  success: Boolean!

  """A list of errors if the mutation was not successful"""
  errors: [MutationError!]

  """DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE"""
  statusCode: Int!

  """DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE"""
  message: String!
}

type GenericMutationErrorExtension implements MutationErrorExtension {
  statusCode: Int
  errorType: String
  fields: JSON
}

type Query {
  extensionContexts(contextIds: [ID!]!): [ExtensionContext!]
  extensionByKey(contextId: ID!, definitionId: ID!, extensionKey: String!): Extension
  echo(text: String!): String
  licenses(appInstallationLicenseDetails: [String!]!): [AppInstallationLicense]
}

"""
An arbitrary extension definition as defined by the Ecosystem
"""
type Extension {
  id: ID!
  definitionId: ID!
  environmentId: ID!
  environmentKey: String!
  environmentType: String!
  installationId: String!
  type: String!
  key: String!
  appOwner: String!
  appVersion: String
  properties: JSON!
  license: AppInstallationLicense
  egress: [AppNetworkEgressPermissionExtension!]
  securityPolicies: [AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionExtension!]
  consentUrl: String
  currentUserConsent: UserConsentExtension
  requiresUserConsent: Boolean
}

type UserConsentExtension {
  user: UserConsentExtensionUser!
  appEnvironmentVersion: UserConsentExtensionAppEnvironmentVersion!
  consentedAt: DateTime!
}

type UserConsentExtensionUser {
  aaid: ID!
}

type UserConsentExtensionAppEnvironmentVersion {
  id: ID!
}

"""
The context in which an extension exists
"""
type ExtensionContext {
  id: ID!
  extensionsByType(type: String!): [Extension!]!
  appAuditLogs(first: Int, after: String ) : AppAuditConnection!
}

type AppInstallationLicense {
  active: Boolean!
  type: String
  supportEntitlementNumber: String
  trialEndDate: DateTime
  subscriptionEndDate: DateTime
  isEvaluation: Boolean
  billingPeriod: String
}

type AppNetworkEgressPermissionExtension {
  type: AppNetworkPermissionTypeExtension
  addresses: [String!]
}

type AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionExtension {
  type: AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionTypeExtension
  policies: [String!]
}

type AppAuditConnection {
  edges: [AuditEventEdge]
  """
  nodes field allows easy access for the first N data items
  """
  nodes: [AuditEvent]
  """
  pageInfo determines whether there are more entries to query.
  """
  pageInfo: AuditsPageInfo
}

type AuditEventEdge {
  cursor: String!
  node: AuditEvent
}

type AuditEvent {
  """
  Audit Event Id
  """
  id: ID!

  """
  The attributes of an audit event
  """
  attributes: AuditEventAttributes!

  """
  Message with content and format to be displayed
  """
  message: AuditMessageObject
}

type AuditEventAttributes {
  """
  The Actor who created the event
  """
  actorId: ID!

  """
  The action for audit log event
  """
  action: String!

  """
  The time when the event occurred
  """
  time: String!

  """
  The Context EventObjects for this event
  """
  context: [ContextEventObject]!

  """
  The Container EventObjects for this event
  """
  container: [ContainerEventObject]!

}

type AuditMessageObject {
  content: String
  format: String
}

type ContextEventObject {
  id: ID!
  type: String!
  attributes: JSON!
}

"""

A major version is one that requires consent from end users before upgrading installations, typically a change in

"""

  id: ID!

  a flag which if true indicates this version is the latest major version for this environment

  A flag which indicates if this version requires a license

  permissions: [AppPermission!]!

scalar DateTime
scalar Long

type Query {
    devOpsMetrics: DevOpsMetrics
}

type DevOpsMetrics {
    deploymentFrequency(
        """Criteria for filtering the data used in metric calculation."""
        filter: DevOpsMetricsFilterInput!

        """Criteria for filtering the data used in metric calculation."""
        environmentCategory: DevOpsEnvironmentCategory! = PRODUCTION

        """How to aggregate the results."""
        rollupType: DevOpsMetricsRollupType! = { type: MEAN }
    ): DevOpsMetricsDeploymentFrequency

    deploymentSize(
        """Criteria for filtering the data used in metric calculation."""
        filter: DevOpsMetricsFilterInput!

        """Criteria for filtering the data used in metric calculation."""
        environmentCategory: DevOpsEnvironmentCategory! = PRODUCTION

        """How to aggregate the results."""
        rollupType: DevOpsMetricsRollupType! = { type: MEAN }
    ): DevOpsMetricsDeploymentSize

    cycleTime(
        """Criteria for filtering the data used in metric calculation."""
        filter: DevOpsMetricsFilterInput!,

        """Whether to include 'mean' cycle time as one of the returned metrics."""
        isIncludeCycleTimeMean: Boolean,

        """Use to specify list of percentile metrics to compute and return results for. Max limit of 5. Values need to be between 0 and 100."""
        cycleTimePercentiles: [Int!]
    ): DevOpsMetricsCycleTime

    perIssueMetrics(
        first: Int!
        after: String
        """Criteria for filtering the data used in metric calculation."""
        filter: DevOpsMetricsPerIssueMetricsFilter!
    ): DevOpsMetricsPerIssueMetricsConnection

    perDeploymentMetrics(
        first: Int!
        after: String
        filter: DevOpsMetricsPerDeploymentMetricsFilter!
    ): DevOpsMetricsPerDeploymentMetricsConnection
}

"""No results will be returned unless an association type is specified. Currently only 'jiraProjectIds' association type is supported."""
input DevOpsMetricsFilterInput {
    """The identifier that indicates which cloud instance this data is to be fetched for."""
    cloudId: ID!

    """The start dateTime for overall time interval to return results for. The interval is inclusive of this value."""
    startFromInclusive: DateTime!

    """The end dateTime for overall time interval to return results for. The interval is exclusive of this value."""
    endAtExclusive: DateTime!

    """
    The Olson Timezone ID. E.g. 'Australia/Sydney'.
    Specifies which timezone to aggregate data in so that daylight savings is taken into account if it occurred between request time range.
    """
    timezoneId: String = "UTC"

    """
    The size of time interval in which to rollup data points in. Default is 1 day.
    E.g. Count of data over 2 weeks with 1 day resolution means rollup is number of datapoints per day over 2 weeks.
    """
    resolution: DevOpsMetricsResolutionInput = { value: 1, unit: DAY }

    """List of Jira projectIds in the given 'cloudId' to fetch metrics for. Max limit of 10."""
    jiraProjectIds: [ID!]

    """Issue level filters. Currently, in order to apply this filter, jiraProjectIds must also be provided"""
    issueFilters: DevOpsMetricsIssueFilters
}

"""No results will be returned unless an association type is specified. Currently only 'jiraProjectIds' association type is supported."""
input DevOpsMetricsPerIssueMetricsFilter {
    """The identifier that indicates which cloud instance this data is to be fetched for."""
    cloudId: ID!

    """The start dateTime for overall time interval to return results for. The interval is inclusive of this value."""
    startFromInclusive: DateTime!

    """The end dateTime for overall time interval to return results for. The interval is exclusive of this value."""
    endAtExclusive: DateTime!

    """List of Jira projectIds in the given 'cloudId' to fetch metrics for. Max limit of 10."""
    jiraProjectIds: [ID!]

    """Issue level filters. Currently, in order to apply this filter, jiraProjectIds must also be provided"""
    issueFilters: DevOpsMetricsIssueFilters
}

input DevOpsMetricsPerDeploymentMetricsFilter {
    cloudId: ID!
    startFromInclusive: DateTime!
    endAtExclusive: DateTime!
    jiraProjectIds: [ID!]
    environmentCategories: [DevOpsEnvironmentCategory!]! = [PRODUCTION]
}

input DevOpsMetricsResolutionInput {
    """Input value for resolution specified."""
    value: Int!

    """Input unit for specified resolution value."""
    unit: DevOpsMetricsResolutionUnit!
}

input DevOpsMetricsIssueFilters {
    """Only issues of these types will be returned."""
    issueTypeIds: [ID!]

    """
    Only issues in these epics will be returned.

    Note:
    * If a null ID is included in the list, issues not in epics will be included in the results.
    * If a subtask's parent issue is in one of the epics, the subtask will also be returned.
    """
    epicIds: [ID]
}

input DevOpsMetricsRollupType {
    type: DevOpsMetricsRollupOption!
    """Must only be specified if the rollup kind is PERCENTILE"""
    percentile: Int
}

enum DevOpsMetricsRollupOption {
    MEAN
    PERCENTILE
}

##### Response #####

enum DeploymentState {
    PENDING
    IN_PROGRESS
    SUCCESSFUL
    CANCELLED
    FAILED
    ROLLED_BACK
    UNKNOWN
}

enum DevOpsEnvironmentCategory {
    PRODUCTION
    STAGING
    TESTING
    DEVELOPMENT
    UNMAPPED
}

type DevOpsMetricsDeploymentFrequencyData {
    """dataTime of data point. Each data point is separated by size of time resolution specified."""
    dateTime: DateTime

    """Number of deployments between ('dateTime') and ('dateTime' + 'resolution')"""
    count: Int
}

type DevOpsMetricsDeploymentFrequency {
    """
    The size of time interval in which data points are rolled up in.
    E.g. Count of data over 2 weeks with 1 day resolution means rollup is number of datapoints per day over 2 weeks.
    """
    resolution: DevOpsMetricsResolution

    """Deployment state. Currently will only return for SUCCESSFUL, no State filter/input supported yet."""
    state: DeploymentState

    """Deployment environment type."""
    environmentType: DevOpsEnvironmentCategory

    """
    Deployment frequency aggregated according to the time resolution and rollup type specified.

    E.g. if the resolution were one week and the rollup type median, this value would be the median weekly
    deployment count.
    """
    aggregateData: Float

    """The deployment frequency data points rolled up by specified resolution."""
    data: [DevOpsMetricsDeploymentFrequencyData]
}

type DevOpsMetricsDeploymentSizeData {
    """dataTime of data point. Each data point is separated by size of time resolution specified."""
    dateTime: DateTime

    """Aggregated number of issues per deployment between ('dateTime') and ('dateTime' + 'resolution')"""
    deploymentSize: Float
}

type DevOpsMetricsDeploymentSize {
    """
    Deployment size aggregated according to the rollup type specified.

    E.g. if the rollup type were median, this will be the median number of issues per deployment
    over the whole time period.
    """
    aggregateData: Float

    """The deployment size data points rolled up by specified resolution."""
    data: [DevOpsMetricsDeploymentSizeData]
}

enum DevOpsMetricsCycleTimePhase {
    """Development phase from initial code commit to opened pull request."""
    COMMIT_TO_PR

    """Development phase from initial code commit to deployed code."""
    COMMIT_TO_DEPLOYMENT
}

type DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeData {
    """dataTime of data point. Each data point is separated by size of time resolution specified."""
    dateTime: DateTime

    """Rolled up cycle time data (in seconds) between ('dateTime') and ('dateTime' + 'resolution'). Roll up method specified by 'metric'."""
    cycleTimeSeconds: Long

    """Number of issues shipped between ('dateTime') and ('dateTime' + 'resolution')."""
    issuesShippedCount: Int
}

interface DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeMetrics {
    """Data aggregated according to the rollup type specified. Rounded to the nearest second."""
    aggregateData: Long

    """The cycle time data points, computed using roll up of the type specified in 'metric'. Rolled up by specified resolution."""
    data: [DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeData]
}

type DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeMean implements DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeMetrics {
    """Mean of data points in 'data' array. Rounded to the nearest second."""
    aggregateData: Long
    data: [DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeData]
}

type DevOpsMetricsCycleTimePercentile implements DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeMetrics {
    """
    The percentile value across all cycle-times in the database between dateTimeFrom and dateTimeTo
    (not across the datapoints in 'data' array). Rounded to the nearest second.
    """
    aggregateData: Long
    data: [DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeData]
    """Percentile metric of returned values. Will be between 0 and 100."""
    percentile: Int
}

type DevOpsMetricsCycleTime {
    """
    The size of time interval in which data points are rolled up in.
    E.g. Count of data over 2 weeks with 1 day resolution means rollup is number of datapoints per day over 2 weeks.
    """
    resolution: DevOpsMetricsResolution

    """The development phase which the cycle time is calculated for."""
    phase: DevOpsMetricsCycleTimePhase

    """Indicates whether user requesting metrics has permission to all contributing issues."""
    hasPermissionForAllContributingIssues: Boolean

    """List of cycle time metrics for each requested roll up metric type."""
    cycleTimeMetrics: [DevOpsMetricsCycleTimeMetrics]
}

type DevOpsMetricsIssueMetrics {
    """ Issue ARI """
    id: ID!
    """ Development time from initial code commit to deployed code in production environment."""
    totalCycleTimeSeconds: Long
    """ Average of review times of all pull requests associated with the issueId."""
    meanReviewTimeSeconds: Long
    commitsCount: Int
    pullRequestsCount: Int
    """ DateTime of the most recent successful deployment to production."""
    lastSuccessfulProductionDeployment: DateTime
}

type DevOpsMetricsIssueMetricsEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: DevOpsMetricsIssueMetrics
}

type DevOpsMetricsPerIssueMetricsConnection {
    edges: [DevOpsMetricsIssueMetricsEdge]
    nodes: [DevOpsMetricsIssueMetrics]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

type DevOpsMetricsDeploymentMetrics {
    deploymentSize: Long
    deploymentId: ID!
}

type DevOpsMetricsDeploymentMetricsEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: DevOpsMetricsDeploymentMetrics
}

type DevOpsMetricsPerDeploymentMetricsConnection {
    edges: [DevOpsMetricsDeploymentMetricsEdge]
    nodes: [DevOpsMetricsDeploymentMetrics]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

##### Common #####

"""Unit for specified resolution value."""
enum DevOpsMetricsResolutionUnit {
    HOUR
    DAY
    WEEK
}

type DevOpsMetricsResolution {
    """Value for resolution specified."""
    value: Int

    """Unit for specified resolution value."""
    unit: DevOpsMetricsResolutionUnit
}

type PageInfo {
    hasNextPage: Boolean!
    hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
    startCursor: String
    endCursor: String
}

implementing this interface should follow the naming convention XYZPayload where XYZ is some chosen type name for
the mutation.

This mutation format is intentionally similar to the error format also used for other resolver errors.

type FooMutationError implements MutationResponse & Payload {

"""

"""

interface MutationErrorExtension {

type AppStorageMutation {

  """

type Query {

  Keys must be between 1-100 characters long and must match the following pattern /^[a-zA-Z0-9:._\s-]+$/
  """
  appStoredEntity(contextAri: ID!, key: ID!, encrypted: Boolean): AppStoredEntity

  """
  appStoredEntities(
    contextAri: ID!
    where: [AppStoredEntityFilter!]
    first: Int
    after: String
  ): AppStoredEntityConnection

  """
  Get an list of untyped entity in a specific context, optional query parameters where condition, first and after
  This endpoint should only be called by functions with cleanup: true, as it will be deprecated once a proper GDPR solution
  is implemented.

  where condition to filter
  returns the first N entities when queried. Should not exceed 100
  this is a cursor after which (exclusive) the data should be fetched from
  """
  appStoredEntitiesForCleanup(
    contextAri: ID!
    where: [AppStoredEntityFilter!]
    first: Int
    after: String
  ): AppStoredEntityConnection @deprecated(reason: "This query is a temporary solution that will be removed")
}

input SetAppStoredEntityMutationInput {
  """
  The identifier for the entity

  Keys must be between 1-100 characters long and must match the following pattern /^[a-zA-Z0-9:._\s-]+$/
  """
  key: ID!

  """
  The ARI to store this entity within
  """
  contextAri: ID!

  """
  Entities may be up to 2000 bytes long. Note that size within ESS may differ from
  the size of the entity sent to this service. The entity size is counted within this service.
  """
  value: JSON!

  """
  Specifies whether value should be encrypted
  """
  encrypted: Boolean
}

type AppStoredEntity {
  """
  Entities may be up to 2000 bytes long. Note that size within ESS may differ from
  the size of the entity sent to this service. The entity size is counted within this service.
  """
  value: JSON

  """
  The identifier for this entity

  Keys must be between 1-100 characters long and must match the following pattern /^[a-zA-Z0-9:._\s-]+$/
  """
  key: ID!
}

type AppStoredEntityConnection {
  """
  The AppStoredEntityConnection is a paginated list of Entities from storage service
  """
  edges: [AppStoredEntityEdge]

  """
  nodes field allows easy access for the first N data items
  """
  nodes: [AppStoredEntity]

  """
  pageInfo determines whether there are more entries to query.
  """
  pageInfo: AppStoredEntityPageInfo

  """
  totalCount is the number of records retrived on a query.
  """
  totalCount: Int
}

type AppStoredEntityEdge {
  """
  Edge is a combination of node and cursor and follows the relay specs.

  Cursor returns the key of the last record that was queried and
  should be used as input to after when querying for paginated entities
  """
  cursor: String!
  node: AppStoredEntity
}

enum AppStoredEntityCondition {
  STARTS_WITH
}

"""
The identifier for this entity

where condition to filter
"""
input AppStoredEntityFilter {
  """Condition filter to be provided when querying for Entities."""
  field: String!
  condition: AppStoredEntityCondition!
  value: AppStoredEntityFieldValue!
}

type AppStoredEntityPageInfo {
  """
  The pageInfo is the place to allow code to navigate the paginated list.
  """
  hasNextPage: Boolean!
  hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
}
jsw:
# The overall Feature Flag information for the issue, includes the details of flag providers as well as configured flags
type FeatureFlagInformation {
    providers: [Provider],
    featureFlags: [FeatureFlag]
}

type Provider {
    # The id of the provider (connect app key)
    id: String!,
    createFlagTemplateUrl: String,
    linkFlagTemplateUrl: String,
    # TODO to be removed once we fast five update to rename to linkFlagTemplateUrl
    associateFlagTemplateUrl: String
}

type FeatureFlag {
    # Can be used to link to a provider record if required
    providerId : String!,
    # the identifier for the feature flag as provided
    id: String!,
    key: String,
    displayName: String,
    summary: FeatureFlagSummary!
    details: [FeatureFlagDetails!]!
}

type FeatureFlagSummary {
    url: String,
    status: FeatureFlagStatus!,
    lastUpdated: String
}

type FeatureFlagStatus {
    enabled: Boolean!,
    defaultValue : String,
    rollout: FeatureFlagRollout
}

type FeatureFlagRollout {
    percentage: Float,
    text: String,
    rules: Int
}

type FeatureFlagDetails {
    url: String!,
    lastUpdated: String!,
    environment: FeatureFlagEnvironment!,
    status: FeatureFlagStatus!
}

type FeatureFlagEnvironment {
    name: String!,
    type: String
}


# Standard relay cursor connection pagination for Timeseries Deployments

type TimeSeriesDeploymentInformationConnection {
    edges: [TimeSeriesDeploymentEdge!]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

type TimeSeriesDeploymentEdge {
    node: TimeSeriesDeployment!
    cursor: String!
}

type TimeSeriesDeployment implements Node {
    id: ID!
    issueIds: [ID!]
    deploymentSequenceNumber: Long
    updateSequenceNumber: Long
    displayName: String
    url: String
    description: String
    state: DeploymentState
    lastUpdated: String
    pipeline: DeploymentPipeline
    environment: DeploymentEnvironment
    provider: DeploymentProvider
}

input DeploymentFilter {
    environmentType: [DeploymentEnvironmentType!]
    environmentName: [String!]
    issueIds: [ID!]!
    timeWindow: TimeWindow!
    order: TimeSeriesSortOrder
}

input TimeWindow {
    afterDateTime: DateTime! # RFC 3339
    beforeDateTime: DateTime! # RFC 3339
}

enum TimeSeriesSortOrder {
    ASC
    DESC
}

schema {
    query: Query,
    mutation: Mutation
}

type Query {
    jsw: JswQuery
    # Root node for queries about agility boards
    agile: AgileQuery
    boardScope(boardId: ID!): BoardScope
    featureFlagInformation(issueId: ID!): FeatureFlagInformation
    deploymentInformation(issueId: ID!): DeploymentInformation
    # Please don't use dataDepotEntities yet. This will soon be merged with developmentInformation. Ask Fusion Team.
    dataDepotEntities(issueId: ID!): DataDepotEntities
    # Generic relay node query
    node(id: ID!): Node
    developmentInformation(issueId: ID!): DevelopmentInformation
    # A list of OAuth credentials which may have permissions to push/read extension data from issues
    oAuthApps: OAuthApps
    # Versions related to the supplied projectId
    projectVersions(
        first: Int! = 25,
        after: String = null,
        filter: [VersionFilter!]! = [],
        projectId: ID!,
        order: VersionOrder! = ASC
    ): ProjectVersionsConnection
    projectSettings(projectId: ID!): ProjectSettings
    # Namespace for time-series deployments (grapevine)
    timeSeriesDeployments(
        first: Int! = 500,
        after: String = null, # Currently we only support "next-page" traversal; "before" is not supported
        filter: DeploymentFilter!
    ) : TimeSeriesDeploymentInformationConnection
    # Global options configured in Jira
    jira: JiraOptions
}

type Mutation {
    jsw: JswMutation

    # Sets the swimlane strategy for the board.  Use NONE is not using swimlanes.
    # Strategy effects everyone who views the board.
    setSwimlaneStrategy(input: SetSwimlaneStrategyInput): SetSwimlaneStrategyOutput

    # Sets the user swimlane strategy for the board.  Use NONE if not using swimlanes.
    # Strategy affects the current user alone.
    setUserSwimlaneStrategy(input: SetSwimlaneStrategyInput): SetSwimlaneStrategyOutput

    # Create a new OAuth app
    createOAuthApp(input: CreateOAuthAppInput!): OAuthAppMutationResponse

    # Update an existing OAuth app
    updateOAuthApp(input: UpdateOAuthAppInput!): OAuthAppMutationResponse

    # Delete an existing OAuth app
    deleteOAuthApp(input: DeleteOAuthAppInput!) : OAuthAppMutationResponse

    startSprint(input: SprintInput): SprintOutput

    createSprint(input: CreateSprintInput): CreateSprintOutput

    completeSprint(input: CompleteSprintInput): CompleteSprintOutput

    deleteSprint(input: DeleteSprintInput): MutationResponse

    moveSprintUp(input: MoveSprintUpInput): MoveSprintUpOutput

    moveSprintDown(input: MoveSprintDownInput): MoveSprintDownOutput

    editSprint(input: EditSprintInput): SprintOutput

    reopenSprint(input: ReopenSprintInput): GenericMutationResponse

    setBoardName(input: SetBoardNameInput): SetBoardNameOutput

    dismissFirstColumnMigrationModal(input: DismissFirstColumnMigrationModalInput): DismissFirstColumnMigrationModalOutput

    setIssueMediaVisibility(input: SetIssueMediaVisibilityInput): SetIssueMediaVisibilityOutput

    cardAddLabel(input: CardAddLabelInput): MutationResponse

    createColumn(input: CreateColumnInput): CreateColumnOutput

    setColumnName(input: SetColumnNameInput): SetColumnNameOutput

    rankColumn(input: RankColumnInput): RankColumnOutput

    setColumnLimit(input: SetColumnLimitInput): SetColumnLimitOutput

    deleteColumn(input: DeleteColumnInput): DeleteColumnOutput

    mutateColumns(input: MutateColumnsInput): MutateColumnsOutput

    addIssuesFlag(input: AddIssuesFlagInput): AddIssuesFlagOutput

    removeIssuesFlag(input: RemoveIssuesFlagInput): RemoveIssuesFlagOutput

    deleteCard(issueId: ID): MutationResponse @deprecated(reason: "Use 'deleteSoftwareCard' instead"),

    moveIssuesToBacklog(input: MoveIssuesToBacklogInput): MoveIssueToBacklogOutput

    hydrateBacklogFromBoard(input: MigrateIssuesInput): HydrateBacklogFromBoardOutput

    assignIssueParent(input: AssignIssueParentInput): AssignIssueParentOutput

    unassignIssueParent(input: UnassignIssueParentInput): UnassignIssueParentOutput

    planModeCardCreate(input: PlanModeCardCreateInput): CreateCardsOutput

    planModeCardMove(input: PlanModeCardMoveInput): MoveCardOutput

    boardCardCreate(input: BoardCardCreateInput): CreateCardsOutput

    boardCardMove(input: BoardCardMoveInput): MoveCardOutput

    boardFeatureToggle(input: BoardToggleFeatureInput): BoardToggleFeatureOutput

    clearCards(input: ClearCardsInput!): ClearCardsOutput

    unclearCards(input: UnclearCardsInput!): GenericMutationResponse

    addFixVersion(input: AddFixVersionInput!): AddFixVersionOutput

    createIssueParent(input: IssueParentCreateInput!): IssueParentCreateOutput

    rankIssueParent(input: IssueParentRankInput!): GenericMutationResponse

    # Set project property for deployments page conditions
    setProjectProperty(input: SetProjectPropertyInput!): GenericMutationResponse

    # Watch an issue
    watchIssue(input: WatchUnwatchIssueInput): WatchUnwatchIssueOutput

    # Unwatch an issue
    unwatchIssue(input: WatchUnwatchIssueInput): WatchUnwatchIssueOutput

    # Sets the issue's assignee
    assignIssue(input: AssignIssueInput): AssignIssueOutput

    # Sets the board's estimation statistic
    setEstimationType(input: SetEstimationTypeInput): GenericMutationResponse

    # Creates a new custom filter
    createCustomFilter(input : CreateCustomFilterInput): CustomFilterCreateOutput

    # Updates a new custom filter
    updateCustomFilter(input : UpdateCustomFilterInput): CustomFilterCreateOutput

    # Deletes a custom filter
    deleteCustomFilter(input: DeleteCustomFilterInput): GenericMutationResponse

    # Creates a new board
    createBoard(input: CreateBoardInput): CreateBoardOutput

    # Deletes a new board
    deleteBoard(input: DeleteBoardInput): GenericMutationResponse
}
