# Root node for queries about agility boards.   Note that rapidboards (non-agility) are not supported.
type AgileQuery {
    board(id: ID): Board,
}

# The agility board
type Board {
    # Id of the board.  Maps to rapidViewId in Jira.  _Subject to change_
    id: ID
    # Name of the board.
    name: String,
    # Board unique identifier as used in ABS.
    uuid: ID,
    # The list of columns on the board
    columns: [Column],
    # The current swimlane strategy for the board.  This is a board (not user) property. All users of the board get the
    # same strategy.
    swimlaneStrategy: SwimlaneStrategy,
    # Whether any issues on the board are hidden due to board clearing logic (e.g. old issues in the done column are hidden)
    hasClearedIssues: Boolean!,
    # _Deprecated Configuration for showing inline issue create
    # Use editConfig.inlineIssueCreate
    inlineIssueCreate: InlineIssueCreateConfig,
    # Configuration for showing media previews on cards
    cardMedia: CardMediaConfig,
    # List of the assignees of all cards currently displayed on the board.
    assignees: [JiraUser],
    # Issuetypes which can be created in this column _outside of a swimlane_ (if any)
    issueTypes: [IssueType]!,
    # All cards on the board, optionally filtered by ID
    cards(cardIds: [ID], customFilterIds: [ID!]): [Card!]!,
    # All issue children which are linked to the cards on the board
    issueChildren: [Card!]!,
    # connect add-ons information
    extension: BoardExtension,
    # Swimlanes on the board.  If swimlanes are set to "NONE" then this there will be a single swimlane object containing
    #  all cards on the board.
    swimlanes: [Swimlane]!,
    # User Swimlanes on the board.  If swimlanes are set to "NONE" then this there will be a single swimlane object containing
    #  all cards on the board.
    userSwimlanes: [Swimlane]!,
    # The location of the board
    location: String!,
    # Board edit config. Contains properties which dictate how to mutate the board data, e.g support for inline issue or column creation
    editConfig: BoardEditConfig,

    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: The project which this board belongs to.  All boards belong to a project, non-project boards are not supported.
    project: Project,
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: List of all features on the board, and their state.
    features: [BoardFeature],
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: List of active and future sprints on this board, if any.  If the sprints feature is not enabled this list will be
    #  empty.
    sprints: [Sprint]!,
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: Backlog configuration about this board.  null if the board does not have a backlog.
    backlog: Backlog,
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: List of reports on this board.  null if reports are not enabled on this board.
    reports: [Report],
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: List of all labels on all cards current displayed on the board.
    labels: [String]!,
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: List of permissions the *user making the request* has for this board.  Different users will see different results.
    boardPermissions: [BoardPermission],
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: Estimation type currently configured for the board.
    estimation: EstimationConfig,
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: List of issue parents from the level above of the base hierarchy (e.g. Epic)
    issueParents: [IssueParent],
    # _Deprecated NEWSHAPE: card on the board with given card ID (card ID is the same as  issue ID)
    card(id: ID): Card,

    # _Deprecated JIRAMUTATION: Temporarily needed to support legacy write API_
    rankCustomFieldId: String,

    # Columns configuration data
    columnConfigs: ColumnsConfig
}

# Root node for queries about simple / agility / nextgen boards.
type BoardScope {
    board: Board!,
    # Current user's swimlane-strategy, NONE if SWAG was unable to retrieve it
    userSwimlaneStrategy: SwimlaneStrategy
    # Null if there's no backlog
    backlog: Backlog,
    # Null if sprints are disabled (empty if there are no sprints)
    sprints(state: [SprintState]): [Sprint],
    # The project location for this board scope.
    projectLocation: Project!,
    # issue parents (AKA Epics) for filtering and adding to cards
    issueParents: [IssueParent]!,
    # List of all features on the board, and their state.
    features: [BoardFeature]!,
    # List of all feature groups on the board. This is similar to the list of features, but support groupings for the frontend to render
    featureGroups: BoardFeatureGroupConnection,
    reports: Reports,
    # Cards in the board scope with given card IDs (card ID is the same as issue ID)
    cards(cardIds: [ID]!, customFilterIds: [ID!]): [Card!]!,
    # Estimation type currently configured for the board.
    estimation: EstimationConfig,
    # Information about the user making this request.
    currentUser: CurrentUser!,
    # return sprint by Id. name can be changed in future because of prototype nature of appolo-related changes
    sprintPrototype(sprintId: String!):Sprint,
    # return sprint by id to be used with start sprint modal
    startSprintPrototype(sprintId: ID!): Sprint,
    # return sprint by Id.
    sprint(sprintId: ID!): Sprint,
    # return reopen sprint info by Id.
    reopenSprintInfo(sprintId: ID!): ReopenSprintInfo,
    # return the custom filters for this board scope
    customFilters: [CustomFilter]
    # Apply custom filters and return filtered card Ids
    filteredCardIds(issueIds: [ID]!, customFilterIds: [ID]!): [ID]
}

# Information about the current user. Different users will see different results.
type CurrentUser {
    # user: JiraUser # Include this when we can supply the user.
    # List of permissions the *user making the request* has for this board.
    permissions: [BoardPermission]!
}

# A card on the board
type Card {
    # ID of the card, same as the issue id
    id: ID!,
    # Jira issue which this card represents
    issue: Issue!,
    # Whether or not this card is flagged
    flagged: Boolean!,
    # Whether or not this card is considered done.  true if the card's issue has a resolution set.
    done: Boolean!,
    # Details of the media to show on this card, null if the card has no media
    coverMedia: CardCoverMedia,
    # Dev Status information for the card
    devStatus: DevStatus,
    # ID of parent issue
    parentId: ID,
    # List of children IDs for an issue
    childrenIds: [ID]
    # Estimate of size of an issue
    estimate: Estimate,
    # Child issues metadata. We could also go full Issue System here.
    childIssuesMetadata: ChildIssuesMetadata,
    # Card priority
    priority: Priority,
    # Due date
    dueDate: String,
    # IDs of the fix versions that this issue is related to
    fixVersions: [ID!]!,
    # Watch status for the issue
    isWatching: Boolean!
}

# Represents a priority of an issue
type Priority {
    # Priority name
    name: String,
    # Priority icon URL
    iconUrl: String,
}

type OldSwimlanes {
    issueTypes: [IssueType]!
}

# Swimlanes separated by column
type Swimlane {
    # The swimlane ID.  This will match the id of the object the swimlane is grouping by.  e.g. Epic's it will be the
    # epic's issue Id.  For assignees it will be the assignee's atlassian account id.   For swimlanes which do not
    # represent a object (e.g. "Issues without assignee's" swimlane) the value will be "0".
    id: ID,
    # The icon to show for the swimlane
    iconUrl: String,
    # The name of the swimlane
    name: String!,
    # Type of swimlane
    type: SwimlaneType,
    # The set of card types allowed in the swimlane
    allowedCardTypes: [IssueType!],
    # The column data
    columnsInSwimlane: [ColumnInSwimlane]!
}

# Swimlane type. The value OTHER is used for those swimlanes that contain items that don't fall any under classification
scalar SwimlaneType

# Represents a column inside a swimlane.  Each swimlane gets a ColumnInSwimlane for each column.
type ColumnInSwimlane {
    # The details of the column
    columnDetails: Column,
    # The cards contained in this column in the given swimlane.
    cards(cardIds: [ID], customFilterIds: [ID!]): [Card]!,
}

# Children metadata for cards
type ChildIssuesMetadata {
    complete: Int
    total: Int
}

type CustomFilter {
    id: ID!,
    name: String!,
    description: String,
    filterQuery: FilterQuery
}

# Sanitised filter query
type FilterQuery {
    sanitisedJql: String!
    errors: [String]
}

# Estimate object which contains an estimate for an issue when it exists
type Estimate {
    storyPoints: Float,
    originalEstimate: OriginalEstimate
}

type OriginalEstimate {
    value: Float,
    valueAsText: String
}

# How to group issues on the board into swimlanes
enum SwimlaneStrategy {
    NONE,
    ASSIGNEE,
    ISSUEPARENT,
    ISSUECHILDREN,
}

# A column on the board
type Column {
    id: ID,
    # The column's name
    name: String,
    # _Deprecated WORKFLOWS_ The cards contained in the column based on the swimlane strategy
    cards(customFilterIds: [ID!]): [Card!]!,
    # Number of cards allowed in this column before displaying a warning.  null if no limit
    maxIssueCount: Int,
    # _Deprecated: Replaced by columnStatus which also include transition details_
    # List of Jira statuses which map to the column
    status: [Status],
    # The statuses mapped to this column
    columnStatus: [ColumnStatus!]!,
    # _Deprecated: Temporarily needed to support legacy write API._
    # The transitionId to use to move any issue on the board *to* this column
    transitionId: Int,
    # Whether this column is the inital column.  Each board has exactly one initial column.
    isInitial: Boolean!,
    # Whether this column is the done column.  Each board has exactly one done column.
    isDone: Boolean!,
}

# A status associated with a column, along with its transitions
type ColumnStatus {
    # Possible transitions into this status
    transitions: [CardTransition!]!,
    # The status
    status: Status!,
    # BETA: Possible card transitions with a certain card type into this column status
    cardTypeTransitions: [SoftwareCardTypeTransition!]
}

# Represents a specific transition between statuses that a card may be able to make.
type CardTransition {
    # Identifier for the card's column in swimlane position, to be used as a target for card transitions
    id: ID
    # Name of the transition, as set in the workflow editor
    name: String!,
    # The status the card's issue will end up in after executing this CardTransition
    status: Status,
    # statuses which can move to this location, null if global transition.
    originStatus: Status,
    # Card type that this transition applies to
    cardType: IssueType!,
    # true if global transition (anything status can move to this location).
    isGlobal: Boolean
    # true if the transition is initial[
    isInitial: Boolean
    # true if the transition has conditions associated with it
    hasConditions: Boolean
}

type SoftwareCardTypeTransition {
    # Non unique ID of the transition used as a target for card transitions
    transitionId: ID
    # Name of the transition, as set in the workflow editor
    name: String!,
    # The status the card's issue will end up in after executing this CardTransition
    status: Status,
    # statuses which can move to this location, null if global transition.
    originStatus: Status,
    # Card type that this transition applies to
    cardType: IssueType!,
    # true if global transition (anything status can move to this location).
    isGlobal: Boolean
    # true if the transition is initial[
    isInitial: Boolean
    # true if the transition has conditions associated with it
    hasConditions: Boolean
}

enum SprintState {
    ACTIVE, FUTURE, CLOSED
}

type Sprint {
    # The location in the board scope
    location: String!,
    id: ID,
    # The sprint's name
    name: String,
    # The sprint's goal, null if no goal is set
    goal: String,
    # The start date of the sprint, in ISO 8601 format
    startDate: String,
    # The end date of the sprint, in ISO 8601 format
    endDate: String,
    # The number of days remaining
    daysRemaining: Int,
    cards(cardIds: [ID], customFilterIds: [ID!]): [Card!]!,
    sprintState: SprintState!,
    sprintMetadata: SprintMetadata
}

type SprintMetadata {
    # Number of Completed Issues in Sprint
    numCompletedIssues: Int,
    # Number of Open Issues in Sprint
    numOpenIssues: Int,
    # Keys of Unresolved Cards
    top100CompletedCardKeysWithIncompleteChildren: [String]
}

type ReopenSprintInfo {
    completedIssuesNotMovedBack: Int,
    incompleteIssuesNotMovedBack: Int,
    issuesMovedBack: Int
}

type Backlog {
    # The location in the board scope
    location: String!,
    # _Deprecated: Temporarily needed to support legacy write API_.  the issue list key to use when creating issue's
    # on the board.  Required when creating issues on a board with backlogs.
    boardIssueListKey: String,
    # Whether or not to show the 'migrate this column to your backlog' prompt (set when first enabling backlogs).
    requestColumnMigration: Boolean!,
    # connect add-ons information
    extension: BacklogExtension,
    cards(cardIds: [ID], customFilterIds: [ID!]): [Card!]!,
    # List of the assignees of all cards currently displayed on the backlog.
    assignees: [JiraUser],
    # List of issue types which can be created directly on the backlog or sprints.
    issueTypes: [IssueType]!,
    # Labels for filtering and adding to cards
    labels: [String]!
}

type Report {
    id: ID!,
    # unique key identifying the report
    key: String!,
    # the name of the report in the user's language
    localisedName: String!,
    # the name of the report in the user's language
    localisedDescription: String!,
    # Which group this report should be shown in
    group: String!,
    # uri of the report's icon
    imageUri: String!,
    # suffix to apply to the reports url to load this report.  e.g.
    #  https://tenant.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=*boardId*&view=reports&report=*urlName*
    urlName: String!,
    # whether or not this report is applicable (is enabled for) this board
    isApplicable: Boolean!
    # if not applicable - localised text as to why
    inapplicableReason: String,
    # if not applicable - localised text as to why
    inapplicableDescription: String,
}

type IssueParent {
    # Jira's issue id
    id: ID!,
    # Jira's issue key
    key: String!,
    # Jira's issue summary
    summary: String!,
    # Some info about its children
    childrenInfo: ChildrenInfo!,
    # Jira's issue type
    issueType: IssueType!,
    # The color for this issue
    color: PaletteColor,
    # The start date set on the issue parent
    startDate: Date,
    # The due date set on the issue parent
    dueDate: Date,
    # The underlying JiraIssue
    issue: Issue
}

type ChildrenInfo {
    todoStats: ChildrenInfoStats
    inProgressStats: ChildrenInfoStats
    doneStats: ChildrenInfoStats
    lastColumnIssueStats: ChildrenInfoStats
}

type ChildrenInfoStats {
    issueCount: Int
}

enum BoardFeatureToggleStatus {
    ENABLED,
    DISABLED,
}

enum BoardFeatureStatus {
    ENABLED,
    DISABLED,
    COMING_SOON,
}

enum BoardFeatureKey {
    BACKLOG,
    SPRINTS,
    DEVTOOLS,
    SIMPLE_ROADMAP,
    REPORTS,
    ESTIMATION,
    PAGES,
    CODE,
    RELEASES,
    DEPLOYMENTS,
    ISSUE_NAVIGATOR,
    ON_CALL_SCHEDULE,
    BOARD
}

# Permissions are calculated from the user making the request.  The current user is implicitly passed with each request
#  thanks to the magic of ASAP.
enum BoardPermission {
    # Can edit the board's configuration
    EDIT_BOARD_CONFIG,
    # Can delete issues on the board or backlog
    DELETE_ISSUE,
    # Can create issues on the board or backlog
    CREATE_ISSUE,
    # Can create / edit / start / stop / delete sprints on this board.
    MANAGE_SPRINT,
    # Can edit issues on the board or backlog
    EDIT_ISSUE
    # Can manage automation rules linked to the board
    MANAGE_AUTOMATION
    # Can move issue to other projects or rank issues on the board and backlog
    MOVE_ISSUE
}

type BoardFeature {
    key: BoardFeatureKey,
    status: BoardFeatureStatus,
    toggle: BoardFeatureToggleStatus,
    category: String!,
    prerequisites: [BoardFeature],
}

# Relay connection definition for a list of board feature groups
type BoardFeatureGroupConnection {
    # Page detail for pagination
    pageInfo: PageInfo,
    # The list of edges of this connection
    edges: [BoardFeatureGroupEdge],
}

# Relay edge definition for a board feature group
type BoardFeatureGroupEdge {
    # The cursor position of this edge. Used for pagination
    cursor: String,
    # The board feature group of the edge
    node: BoardFeatureGroup,
}

type BoardFeatureGroup implements Node {
    id: ID!,
    name: String,
    # The board features in this group
    features(ids: [String!], first: Int, after: String): BoardFeatureConnection,
}

# Relay connection definition for a list of board features
type BoardFeatureConnection {
    pageInfo: PageInfo,
    edges: [BoardFeatureEdge],
}

# Relay edge definition for a board feature
type BoardFeatureEdge {
    # The cursor position of this edge. Used for pagination
    cursor: String,
    # The feature group of the edge
    node: BoardFeatureView,
}

union BoardFeatureView = BasicBoardFeatureView | EstimationBoardFeatureView

type BasicBoardFeatureView implements Node {
    id: ID!,
    title: String,
    description: String,
    # Possible states: ENABLED, DISABLED, COMING_SOON
    status: String,
    canEnable: Boolean,
    learnMoreLink: String,
    imageUri: String,
}

type EstimationBoardFeatureView implements Node {
    id: ID!,
    title: String,
    description: String,
    # Possible states: ENABLED, DISABLED, COMING_SOON
    status: String,
    canEnable: Boolean,
    learnMoreLink: String,
    imageUri: String,
    permissibleEstimationTypes: [PermissibleEstimationType],
    selectedEstimationType: PermissibleEstimationType
}

type PermissibleEstimationType {
    # Possible estimation type values: STORY_POINTS, ORIGINAL_ESTIMATE, ISSUE_COUNT (Issue count is not supported yet)
    value: String,
    name: String,
    description: String
}

type CardCoverMedia {
    attachmentMediaApiId: ID,
    attachmentId: Long,
    token: String,
    clientId: String,
    #endpoint to retrieve the media from
    endpointUrl: String,
    #true if this card has media, but it's explicity been hidden by the user
    hiddenByUser: Boolean!,
}

type InlineIssueCreateConfig {
    enabled: Boolean!,
    useGlobalCreate: Boolean,
}

type CardMediaConfig {
    # Whether or not to show card media on this board
    enabled: Boolean!,
}

type EstimationConfig {
    # Currently configured estimation.
    current: CurrentEstimation!,
    # All available estimation types that can be used in the project.
    available: [AvailableEstimations!]!,
}

type CurrentEstimation {
    # Custom field configured as the estimation type. Null when estimation feature is disabled.
    customFieldId: String,
    # Name of the custom field.
    name: String,
}

type AvailableEstimations {
    # Unique identifier of the estimation. Temporary naming until we remove "statistic" from Jira.
    statisticFieldId: String!,
    # Name of the estimation.
    name: String!,
}

### Dev status context ###

type DevStatus {
    activity: DevStatusActivity!,
    count: Int,
}

enum DevStatusActivity{
    PR_OPEN,
    PR_MERGED,
    PR_DECLINED,
    BRANCH_OPEN,
    COMMIT
}

### Jira Issue context ###

enum IssueTypeHierarchyLevelType{
    CHILD,
    BASE,
    PARENT
}

type IssueType {
    # Issue type ID from Jira
    id: ID,
    # Issue type ID from Jira
    jiraId: ID,
    # Issue type UUID
    externalId: ID,
    # Issue type's name
    name: String,
    # URL to the icon to show for this issue type on the card
    iconUrl: String,
    # The configuration for creating issues with this issue type inline.
    inlineIssueCreate: InlineIssueCreateConfig
    # The type of hierarchy level that issue type belongs to
    hierarchyLevelType: IssueTypeHierarchyLevelType
}

# The Jira project which this board belongs to
enum ProjectFeatureToggleStatus {
    ENABLED,
    DISABLED,
}

enum ProjectFeatureStatus {
    ENABLED,
    DISABLED,
    COMING_SOON,
}

enum ProjectFeatureKey {
    PAGES,
    CODE,
    RELEASES,
    DEPLOYMENTS,
    ISSUE_NAVIGATOR,
    ON_CALL_SCHEDULE,
}

type ProjectFeature {
    key: ProjectFeatureKey,
    status: ProjectFeatureStatus,
    toggle: ProjectFeatureToggleStatus,
}

type Project {
    # Project id from Jira
    id: ID,
    # Project key from Jira
    key: String,
    # Project name from Jira
    name: String,
    # True when a project is a simplified (donut world) project, false if it is a hybrid project
    isSimplifiedProject: Boolean,
    # List of issue types available in the project with an optional filter of hierarchyLevelType
    # When the filter is not present (null):
    # * On 'Board', base level types will be returned by default
    # * On 'BoardScope', all types will be returned by default
    issueTypes(hierarchyLevelType: IssueTypeHierarchyLevelType = null): [IssueType],
    # Versions related to this project
    # The argument "first" specifies the number of items asked to be retrieved (i.e. The page size).
    # The argument "after" sets the cursor of an edge. This represents the non-inclusive start of the page.
    versions(
        first: Int! = 25,
        after: String = null,
        filter: [VersionFilter!]! = [],
        order: VersionOrder! = ASC,
    ): ProjectVersionsConnection
    features: [ProjectFeature]
}

# The Jira Issue which a card represents
type Issue {
    # Jira's issue id
    id: ID,
    # Jira's issue key
    key: String,
    # Jira's issue summary
    summary: String,
    # List of labels the issue has.
    labels: [String],
    # The issue's type
    type: IssueType,
    # The issue's status.  The status controls which column the issue displays in.
    status: Status,
    # Current assignee of the issue, null if no assignee
    assignee: JiraUser,
    # transitions associated that may be able to be performed on this issue
    # Note: We only support returning this for a single issue
    transitions: [IssueTransition]
}

# Jira's representation of a transition that can be performed by a user
type IssueTransition {
    # Identifier for the card's column in swimlane position, to be used as a target for card transitions
    id: ID!
    # Name of the transition, as set in the workflow editor
    name: String!,
    # Whether the transition is available to be performed
    isAvailable: Boolean!
    # The id of the status this transitions goes to
    toStatusId: String!,
    # Whether this status has a screen associated with it
    hasScreen: Boolean!,
    # whether the transition is global
    isGlobal: Boolean!,
    # whether this is an initial transition
    isInitial: Boolean!,
    # whether a condition is associated with the status
    isConditional: Boolean!
}

# The current status of an issue, from the issue's workflow in Jira
type Status {
    id: ID,
    name: String,
    # Which status category this statue belongs to.  Values:  "undefined" | "new" (ie todo) | "indeterminate" (aka "in progress") | "done"
    category: String,
    # Whether or not cards can be created in this status.  This will be true if the status is the first status in the
    #  workflow or if there is a global transition to the status.
    cardCreateEnabled: Boolean!
}

# Represents a status object from a workflow in Jira without any calculcated fields
type RawStatus {
    # Unique identifier of the status, in UUID type
    id: ID,
    # Jira's Id of the status
    jiraId: ID,
    # Name of the status
    name: String,
    # Which status category this statue belongs to.  Values:  "undefined" | "new" (ie todo) | "indeterminate" (aka "in progress") | "done"
    category: String
}

type BoardExtension {
    # list of operations that add-on can perform
    operations: [Operation],
}

type BacklogExtension {
    # list of operations that add-on can perform
    operations: [Operation],
}

type Operation {
    icon: Icon,
    name: String,
    url: String,
    tooltip: String,
    styleClass: String,
}

type Icon {
    url: String,
}

# Delete sprint
input DeleteSprintInput {
    boardId: ID!
    sprintId: ID!
}

# General Report Types
# ====================
type TimeSeriesPoint {
    id: ID!,
    x: DateTime!,
    y: Int!,
}

# Querying reports
# ================
# > Types that define the queries for reports and their data structures

# Node for querying any report page's data
type Reports {
    # Data for the reports list overview
    overview: ReportsOverview
    # Data for the cumulative flow diagram report
    cumulativeFlowDiagram: CumulativeFlowDiagram
    # Data for the burndown chart. For the burndown report we care about remaining scope.
    burndownChart: BurndownChart!
    # Data for the burnup chart. For the burnup report we care about completed scope
    burnupChart: BurndownChart!
}

# Burndown chart focuses on remaining scope over time
type BurndownChart {
    # Burndown charts are graphing the remaining over time
    chart(sprintId: ID, estimation: SprintReportsEstimationStatistic): BurndownChartData!

    # Filters for the report
    filters: SprintReportsFilters!
}

type SprintReportsFilters {
    # List of sprints to select from
    sprints: [Sprint]!
    # Possible statistic that we want to track
    estimationStatistic: [SprintReportsEstimationStatistic]!
}

enum SprintReportsEstimationStatistic {
    STORY_POINTS
    ISSUE_COUNT
    ORIGINAL_ESTIMATE
}

type BurndownChartData {
    # the start time of the sprint
    startTime: DateTime

    # the set end time of the sprint, not when the sprint completed
    endTime: DateTime

    # data for sprint start event
    sprintStartEvent: SprintStartData!

    # data for a sprint scope change
    # each point are assumed to be scope change during a sprint
    scopeChangeEvents: [SprintScopeChangeData]!

    # data for sprint end event
    # can be null if sprint has not been completed yet
    sprintEndEvent: SprintEndData

    # data for the table
    table: BurndownChartDataTable

    # the current user's timezone
    timeZone: String
}

type BurndownChartDataTable {
    scopeChanges: [BurndownChartDataTableScopeChangeRow]!
    incompleteIssues: [BurndownChartDataTableIssueRow]!
    completedIssues: [BurndownChartDataTableIssueRow]!
    completedIssuesOutsideOfSprint: [BurndownChartDataTableIssueRow]!
    issuesRemovedFromSprint: [BurndownChartDataTableIssueRow]!
}

type BurndownChartDataTableScopeChangeRow {
    timestamp: DateTime!
    sprintScopeChange: SprintScopeChangeData!
    issueType: IssueType
    issueParent: IssueParent
}

type BurndownChartDataTableIssueRow {
    issueKey: String!
    issueSummary: String!
    issueType: IssueType
    issueParent: IssueParent
    status: Status
    assignee: JiraUser
    estimate: Float
}

type SprintStartData {
    timestamp: DateTime!

    # list of all issues that are in the sprint with their estimates
    issueList: [ScopeSprintIssue]!

    # scope estimate for start of sprint
    scopeEstimate: Float!
}

type ScopeSprintIssue {
    # issue key
    issueKey: String!

    # issue description
    issueSummary: String!

    # the estimate on the issue
    estimate: Float!
}

type SprintEndData {
    # timestamp of when sprint was completed
    timestamp: DateTime!

    # list of all issues that are in the sprint with their estimates
    issueList: [ScopeSprintIssue]!

    # scope remaining at the end of the sprint
    remainingEstimate: Float!

    # scope completed at the end of the sprint
    completion: Float!

    # Total scope at the end of the sprint
    scope: Float!
}

type SprintScopeChangeData {
    # timestamp of change
    timestamp: DateTime!

    # the issue involved in the change
    issueKey: String!

    # the issue description
    issueSummary: String!

    # type of event
    eventType: ScopeChangeEventType!

    # sprint scope after this change
    scope: Float!

    # amount completed of the esimtation statistic
    completion: Float!

    # amount remaining of the estimation statistic
    remaining: Float!

    # estimation of the issue after this change
    estimate: Float

    # the previous completed amount before this change
    prevCompletion: Float!

    # the sprint scope before the change
    prevScope: Float!

    # the previous remaining amount before this change
    prevRemaining: Float!

    # the previous estimation before this change
    prevEstimate: Float
}

enum ScopeChangeEventType {

    ISSUE_REMOVED

    TRANSITION_TO_DONE
    TRANSITION_TO_NOT_DONE
    COLUMN_CHANGE
    UNKNOWN_EVENT
}

### Common Jira Schema types ###

### Jira user context ###

# The various sizes of avatar urls that are supported, see https://atlaskit.atlassian.com/packages/core/avatar
type AvatarUrls {
    # A 16 by 16 avatar
    xsmall: String
    # A 24 by 24 avatar
    small: String
    # A 32 by 32 avatar
    medium: String
    # A 48 by 48 avatar
    large: String
}

# Jira's representation of a user.  distinct from identites representation.  _Subject to change with GDPR work_
type JiraUser {
    # ID for the user generated by swag.  This is not an AAID or Jira user ID.  This field will change in the future.
    id: ID

    # User's account id
    accountId: String

    # User's name
    name: String

    # Name to display for the user when rendering
    displayName: String

    # The time zone the user has configured for themselves
    timeZone: String

    # Default avatar URL to use when rendering the user
    avatarUrl: String

    # Alternative avatar urls for different sizes
    avatarUrls: AvatarUrls
}

# Supported colors in the Palette
enum PaletteColor {
    PURPLE,
    BLUE,
    GREEN,
    TEAL,
    YELLOW,
    ORANGE,
    GREY,

    DARK_BLUE,
    DARK_GREEN,
    DARK_TEAL,
    DARK_YELLOW,
    DARK_ORANGE,
    DARK_GREY
}

type OAuthApps {
    apps: [OAuthApp]

# An OAuth app which may have permissions to push/read extension data from issues
type OAuthApp {
    # Id of this app
    id: ID!
    # Name of this app
    name: String!
    # Home URL from which this app should be accessible
    homeUrl: String!
    # Logo of this app which will be shown on the screen
    logoUrl: String!
    # OAuth client id credential for this app
    clientId: String!
    # OAuth secret id credential for this app
    secret: String!
    # Module for reading/writing builds data using these credentials
    buildsModule: OAuthAppBuildsModule
    # Module for reading/writing feature flags data using these credentials
    featureFlagsModule: OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModule
    # Module for reading/writing deployments data using these credentials
    deploymentsModule: OAuthAppDeploymentsModule
    # Module for reading/writing development information data using these credentials
    devInfoModule: OAuthAppDevInfoModule
}

type OAuthAppBuildsModule {
    # True if this app can read/write builds data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on builds data
    # Disabled because we can't have empty inputs in graphql
    #actions: OAuthAppBuildsModuleActions
}

type OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModule {
    # True if this app can read/write feature flags data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on feature flags data
    actions: OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModuleActions
}

type OAuthAppDeploymentsModule {
    # True if this app can read/write deployments data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on deployments data
    actions: OAuthAppDeploymentsModuleActions
}

type OAuthAppDevInfoModule {
    # True if this app can read/write development information data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on development information data
    actions: OAuthAppDevInfoModuleActions
}

# Disabled because we can't have empty inputs in graphql
#type OAuthAppBuildsModuleActions {
#    # Empty on purpose.
#}

type OAuthAppDevInfoModuleActions {

}

type OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModuleActions {
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a create feature flag button on the issue view
    createFlag: UrlTemplate
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a link feature flag button on the issue view
    linkFlag: UrlTemplate
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a list feature flags button on the issue view
    listFlag: UrlTemplate
}

type OAuthAppDeploymentsModuleActions {
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a list deployments button on the issue view
    listDeployments: UrlTemplate
}

type UrlTemplate {
    urlTemplate: String!
}

## Mutations

type OAuthAppMutationResponse implements MutationResponse {
    statusCode: Int!
    # _Deprecated_ according to the graphql standard, we should be using statusCode instead
    # see https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GRAPHQL/pages/413770807/Mutation
    code: Int!
    # True if the mutation was successful, false otherwise
    success: Boolean!
    message: String!
    # The ClientMutationId sent on the mutation input will be reflected here
    clientMutationId: ID
    # The state of the app after the mutation was applied
    app: OAuthApp
}

input CreateOAuthAppInput {
    # The app that should be created
    app: OAuthAppInput!
    # An id for this mutation
    clientMutationId: ID
}

input UpdateOAuthAppInput {
    # The id of the app which will be changed
    id: ID!
    # The state the app should be after updating it
    app: OAuthAppInput!
    # An id for this mutation
    clientMutationId: ID
}

input DeleteOAuthAppInput {
    # The id of the app which will be deleted
    clientId: ID!
    # An id for this mutation
    clientMutationId: ID
}

input OAuthAppInput {
    # Name of this app
    name: String!
    # Home URL from which this app should be accessible
    homeUrl: String!
    # Logo of this app which will be shown on the screen
    logoUrl: String!

    # Module for reading/writing builds data using these credentials
    buildsModule: OAuthAppBuildsModuleInput
    # Module for reading/writing feature flags data using these credentials
    featureFlagsModule: OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModuleInput
    # Module for reading/writing deployments data using these credentials
    deploymentsModule: OAuthAppDeploymentsModuleInput
    # Module for reading/writing development information data using these credentials
    devInfoModule: OAuthAppDevInfoModuleInput
}

input OAuthAppBuildsModuleInput {
    # True if this app can read/write builds data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on builds data
    # Disabled because we can't have empty inputs in graphql
    #actions: OAuthAppBuildsModuleActionsInput
}

input OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModuleInput {
    # True if this app can read/write feature flags data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on feature flags data
    actions: OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModuleActionsInput
}

input OAuthAppDeploymentsModuleInput {
    # True if this app can read/write deployments data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on deployments data
    actions: OAuthAppDeploymentsModuleActionsInput
}

input OAuthAppDevInfoModuleInput {
    # True if this app can read/write development information data
    isEnabled: Boolean!
    # Actions that this app can invoke on development information data
    actions: OAuthAppDevInfoModuleActionsInput
}

# Commented out because we can't have empty inputs in graphql
#input OAuthAppBuildsModuleActionsInput {
##     Empty on purpose.
#}

input OAuthAppDevInfoModuleActionsInput {
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a create branch button on the issue view
    createBranch: UrlTemplateInput
}

input OAuthAppFeatureFlagsModuleActionsInput {
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a create feature flag button on the issue view
    createFlag: UrlTemplateInput
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a link feature flag button on the issue view
    linkFlag: UrlTemplateInput
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a list feature flags button on the issue view
    listFlag: UrlTemplateInput
}

input OAuthAppDeploymentsModuleActionsInput {
    # An UrlTemplate which the app can inject a list deployments button on the issue view
    listDeployments: UrlTemplateInput
}

input UrlTemplateInput {
    urlTemplate: String!
}

# Don't use this yet.
type DataDepotEntities {
    featureFlagInformation: FeatureFlagInformation
    deploymentInformation: DeploymentInformation
    remoteLinkInformation: RemoteLinkInformation
}

type TimeTrackingOptions {
    workingHoursPerDay: Float,
    workingDaysPerWeek: Float,
    defaultUnit: String,
    timeFormat: String,
}

type JiraOptions {
    timeTrackingOptions: TimeTrackingOptions
}

# Standard relay cursor connection pagination for ProjectVersions
type ProjectVersionsConnection {
    edges: [ProjectVersionEdge!]!
    pageInfo: PageInfo
}

# Edge wrapper of a project version node and its cursor
type ProjectVersionEdge {
    node: ProjectVersion!
    # The cursor used to determine position of the node.
    cursor: String!
}

type ProjectVersion {
    # The ID of the version.
    id: ID!,
    # The ID of the project to which this version is attached.
    projectId: ID!
    # The unique name of the version.
    # Required when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.
    # The maximum length is 255 characters.
    name: String!
    # The description of the version. Optional when creating or updating a version.
    description: String
    # Indicates that the version is archived.
    isArchived: Boolean
    # Indicates that the version is released.
    isReleased: Boolean
    # The start date of the version.
    startDate: Date
    # The release date of the version.
    releaseDate: Date
    # The count of issues in this version for each of the status categories
    # "to do", "in progress", "done", and "unmapped".
    # The "unmapped" property contains a count of issues with a status other than
    # "to do", "in progress", and "done".
    issuesStatus: VersionIssuesStatus!
}

type VersionIssuesStatus {
    # Count of issues with a status other than "to do", "in progress", and "done".
    unmapped: Long!
    # Count of issues with status "to do".
    toDo: Long!
    # Count of issues with status "in progress".
    inProgress: Long!
    # Count of issues with status "done".
    done: Long!
}

enum VersionFilter {
    ARCHIVED
    RELEASED
    UNRELEASED
}

enum VersionOrder {
    ASC
    DESC
}


# Schema for Dev Panel Summary

# Information related to the development process of an issue
type DevelopmentInformation {
    summary: DevSummary
    details(instanceTypes: [String!]! = []): DevDetails
}

# Summary of VCS and build/release related to an issue
type DevSummary {
    branches: BranchesSummary
    commits: CommitsSummary
    pullrequests: PullRequestsSummary
    reviews: ReviewsSummary
    builds: BuildsSummary
    deployments: DeploymentsSummary
}

# Specific information related to a specific provider
# i.e.: Bitbucket/Github branches/PRs/commits or Bamboo/BB Pipelines deployments
type ApplicationSummary {
    # Display name of the application
    name: String!
    # Counter of items related to this application
    itemCount: Int!
    # Application type name e.g. bitbucket/stash/github/githube
    applicationType: String!
}

# General information of the branches related to an issue
type BranchesSummary {
    # Total count of branches
    count: Int!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    applicationSummaries: [ApplicationSummary!]!
}

# General information of the commits related to an issue
type CommitsSummary {
    count: Int!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    applicationSummaries: [ApplicationSummary!]!
}

# General information of the pull requests related to an issue
type PullRequestsSummary {
    count: Int!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    applicationSummaries: [ApplicationSummary!]!
    # Display a consolidated overall status of the PRs
    status: String!
    statusCount: Int!
}

# General information of the reviews related to an issue
# that has a connection with Fisheye and Crucible
type ReviewsSummary {
    count: Int!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    applicationSummaries: [ApplicationSummary!]!
    # Possible review status are: REVIEW | APPROVAL | SUMMARIZE | REJECTED | CLOSED
    status: String!
    # Deadline of the review
    dueDate: DateTime!
    isOverdue: Boolean!
    # Short for the completion status of the review
    isCompleted: Boolean!
}

# General information of the builds related to an issue
type BuildsSummary {
    count: Int!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    applicationSummaries: [ApplicationSummary!]!
    failedCount: Int!
    successCount: Int!
    unknownCount: Int!
}

# General information of the deployments related to an issue
type DeploymentsSummary {
    count: Int!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    applicationSummaries: [ApplicationSummary!]!
    # Interface condition for showing the deployment projects
    isShowingProjects: Boolean!
    successCount: Int!
    # Short list with the top environments deployed
    topEnvironments: [DeploymentSummaryEnvironment!]!
}

# Review possible merge with deployments.graphqls#DeploymentEnvironment in the future
type DeploymentSummaryEnvironment {
    id: ID!
    position: Int!
    project: DeploymentProject!
    status: String!
    title: String!
    url: String!
}

# Possibly has the same purpose of deployments.graphqls#DeploymentPipeline
type DeploymentProject {
    id: ID!
    name: String!
    url: String!
}

# Aggregates all the instance types (bitbucket, stash, github) and its development information
type DevDetails {
    instanceTypes: [Instance!]!
    featureFlagProviders: [FeatureFlagProvider!]
    deploymentProviders: [DeploymentProviderDetails!]
    remoteLinksByType: RemoteLinksByType
    embeddedMarketplace: EmbeddedMarketplace!
}

# Detailed information of an instance and its data (source data, build data, deployment data)
type Instance {
    id: String!
    # The name of the instance type
    name: String!
    # Raw type of the instance. e.g. bitbucket, stash, github, githube
    type: String!
    repository: [RepositoryDetails!]
    buildProviders: [BuildProvider!]
    # The descriptive name of the instance type. e.g. Bitbucket Cloud
    typeName: String!
    # Indicates if it is possible to return more than a single instance per type. Only possible with FeCru
    isSingleInstance: Boolean!
    baseUrl: String!
    # An error message related to this instance passed down from DevStatus
    # These are not GraphQL errors. When an instance type is requested,
    # DevStatus may respond with a list instances and strings nested inside the "errors" field, as follows:
    # `{ "errors": [{"_instance": { ... }, error: "unauthorized" }], detail: [ ... ] }`.
    # The status code for this response however is still 200
    # since only part of the instances requested may present these issues.
    # `devStatusErrorMessage` is deprecated. Use `devStatusErrorMessages`.
    devStatusErrorMessage: String
    devStatusErrorMessages: [String!]!
    # There are common cases where a Pull Request is merged and its branch is deleted.
    # The downstream sources do not provide repository information on the PR, only branches information.
    # When the branch is deleted, it's not possible to create the bridge between PRs and Repository.
    # For this reason, any PR that couldn't be assigned to a repository will appear on this list.
    danglingPullRequests: [PullRequestDetails!]!
}

# Detailed information of a VCS repository
type RepositoryDetails {
    # The repository avatar URL
    avatarUrl: String
    description: String
    name: String!
    url: String
    # A reference to the parent repository from where this has been forked for
    parent: RepositoryParent
    pullRequests: [PullRequestDetails!]!
    branches: [BranchDetails!]!
    commits: [CommitDetails!]!
}

# Short description of the parent repository from which the fork was made
type RepositoryParent {
    name: String!
    url: String
}

# A build pipeline provider
type BuildProvider {
    id: String!
    name: String!
    url: String!
    description: String
    avatarUrl: String
    builds: [BuildDetail!]
}

# Detailed information about a build tied to a provider
type BuildDetail {
    id: String!
    buildNumber: Int!
    name: String!
    description: String
    url: String!
    state: String!
    testSummary: TestSummary!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    references: [BuildReference!]
}

# A summary for the tests results for a particular build
type TestSummary {
    totalNumber: Int!
    numberPassed: Int!
    numberFailed: Int!
    numberSkipped: Int!
}

# Information that links a build to a version control system (commits, branches, etc.)
type BuildReference {
    name: String!
    uri: String!
}

# Detailed information of a pull request
type PullRequestDetails {
    id: String!
    url: String!
    name: String!
    branchName: String!
    branchUrl: String
    # Time of the last update in ISO 8601 format
    lastUpdate: DateTime!
    commentCount: Int
    # Possible status of a PR are: OPEN | MERGED | DECLINED
    status: String!
    author: Author!
    reviewers: [PullRequestReviewer!]!
}

# Description of a pull request or commit author
type Author {
    # The avatar URL of the author
    avatarUrl: String
    name: String!
}

# Description of a pull request reviewer
type PullRequestReviewer {
    # The avatar URL of the reviewer
    avatarUrl: String
    name: String!
    # Flag representing if the reviewer has already approved the PR
    isApproved: Boolean!
}

# Detailed information of a repository's branch
type BranchDetails {
    name: String!
    url: String
    createReviewUrl: String
    createPullRequestUrl: String
    lastCommit: HeadCommit
    pullRequests: [BranchPullRequestStatesSummary!]!
    reviews: [Review!]
}

# Latest commit on a branch
type HeadCommit {
    url: String
    displayId: String!
    # Time of the commit in ISO 8601 format
    timestamp: DateTime
}

# Short description of a pull request associated with a branch
type BranchPullRequestStatesSummary {
    name: String!
    url: String
    # Possible status of a PR are: OPEN | MERGED | DECLINED
    status: String!
    # Time of the last update in ISO 8601 format
    lastUpdate: DateTime!
}

# Short desciption of a review associated with a branch or commit
type Review {
    state: String!
    url: String!
    id: String!
}

# Detailed information of a commit in a repository
type CommitDetails {
    id: String!
    isMerge: Boolean!
    # Time of the commit update in ISO 8601 format
    timestamp: DateTime!
    url: String
    createReviewUrl: String
    displayId: String!
    message: String!
    author: Author
    files: [CommitFile!]!
    reviews: [Review!]!
}

# Information of a file modified in a commit
type CommitFile {
    linesAdded: Int
    linesRemoved: Int
    # Possible types of change are: ADDED | DELETED | COPIED | MOVED | MODIFY | UNKNOWN
    changeType: String!
    url: String
    path: String!
}

type FeatureFlagProvider {
    id: String!,
    createFlagTemplateUrl: String,
    linkFlagTemplateUrl: String,
    featureFlags: [FeatureFlag!]!
}

type RemoteLinkType {
    type: String!,
    remoteLinks: [RemoteLink!]!
}

type RemoteLinksByType {
    providers: [RemoteLinkProvider!]!,
    types: [RemoteLinkType!]!
}

# A set of booleans that indicate if the embedded marketplace
# should be shown if a user does not have installed providers
type EmbeddedMarketplace {
    shouldDisplayForFeatureFlags: Boolean!
    shouldDisplayForBuilds: Boolean!
    shouldDisplayForDeployments: Boolean!
}

# This object witholds deployment providers essential information,
# as well as its list of latest deployments per pipeline.
# A provider without deployments related to the asked issueId will not be returned.
type DeploymentProviderDetails {
    id: String!
    name: String!
    homeUrl: String!
    logoUrl: String
    # A list of the latest deployments of each pipeline
    deployments: [DeploymentDetails!]!
}

# Detailed information of a deployment
type DeploymentDetails {
    displayName: String
    url: String
    state: DeploymentState!
    lastUpdated: DateTime!
    environment: DeploymentEnvironment!
    pipelineId: String!
    pipelineDisplayName: String!
    pipelineUrl: String!
}

# A DateTime field in RFC3339 format implemented by the graphql java extended scalars
scalar DateTime
# A Date field in RFC3339 format implemented by the graphql java extended scalars
scalar Date
# A JSON field implemented by the graphql java extended scalars
scalar JSON

# This is not necessary for running swag instance but for validation
scalar Long

### Mutations ###

interface MutationResponse {
    statusCode: Int!
    success: Boolean!
    message: String!
    clientMutationId: ID
}

type GenericMutationResponse implements MutationResponse {
    statusCode: Int!
    # True if the mutation was successful, false otherwise
    success: Boolean!
    message: String!
    clientMutationId: ID
}


# Standard relay pagination structure
type PageInfo {
    # Whether there is there a next page
    hasNextPage: Boolean!
    # Whether there is a previous page
    hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
    # The start of this page
    startCursor: String
    # The end of this page
    endCursor: String
}

# Standard Relay node interface
interface Node {
    # The id of the node
    id: ID!
}
